description:
I thought pistachio was good - one of my favorite ice cream flavors - until I tried the gianduja (chocolate and hazelnut). Now that is my new default order. The salted butter caramel was good too. This shop rotates flavors-creations with descriptive names, and you may sample before purchase. You could also vote your preferences on a chalkboard, so it's whimsical as well.

This is a bright and clean small shop; the decor and color scheme is pretty simple. The gelato is complex, however, and is so good that my colleagues and I stop by whenever we lunch at nearby HRD (https://www.yelp.com/biz/hrd-san-francisco-4). The prices are relatively low compared to the fancy ice cream shops that dot the City.

Note they have a frequent visitor stamp card. Each purchase gets a stamped and after 9 stamps you get a freebie. Also, a yelp check-in gets you a small cone and flavor of the week.
author: Peter L.

description:
I have definitely had my share of good ice cream and gelato, but nothing has yet to compare to Coletta (and this is speaking for all ice cream experiences I have had throughout the US). The ice cream shop is on a random street in SoMa, and parking can be sometimes difficult, even though some spots are available right up front. 

They have an assortment of flavors, including seasonal ones like pumpkin, and they're apparently known for their pistachio. That day, I went for the daily special of hazelnut latte, which literally tasted like coffee and Nutella in gelato form! I also tried their peach gelato, and it tasted just like a fresh peach. 

I definitely see myself coming back pretty often! I'd highly recommend giving this mom-and-pop a try!
author: Sandra S.

description:
My favorite gelato place in SF! Great creamy texture and rotating small batch flavors. My favorites are the gianduja, pistachio, and pumpkin cheesecake (seasonal).

There are a couple of counter stool seats along the window. Fridge on the side with pints. We ran into the owner and chatted a bit, and it's clear he is passionate about making gelato.

Will be back.
author: Eva W.

description:
The gelato here is so delicious! I was wondering why Coletta's store hours were so strange and short. After visiting I now know why - this place is super popular and will have a line out the door! A lot of the customers are from offices in the area. 

I highly recommend getting the waffle cone. It's only $5 and you get two scoops of gelato. The two scoops of ice cream in a cup is also $5 and (between you and me) I think you get less gelato in the cup than in a cone. 

I tried the tiramisu and the pistachio flavors. Both were some of the best gelato I've ever had (and I've been to Italy!) The gelato was very fresh and high quality. It tasted smooth and creamy. the pistachio was a faint yellow color which is really different from the artificial green colors grocery stores might sell. 

You can also buy a pint of ice cream from their fridge! I might be doing that next time because I find myself craving this place a lot. I would recommend coming here for a sweet midday snack!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Do yourself a favor and try out their amazing gelatos! 

Here's why: 
- 2 flavors for $5 (very cheap compared to many ice cream shops in SF) 
- FREE WAFFLE CONE 
- they let you sample like ALL their flavors 
- the workers are super nice
- they have a public restroom you can use 
- they have traditional, authentic & unique flavors
- creamy texture and strong flavors 
- cute (but small) interior

We especially enjoyed their Pistachio Flavor - SO GOOD! Better than Talenti!
author: Samantha F.

description: Some of the best gelato I have ever had !! Try as many samples as possible they are all great. I got the gluten free pistachio and coffee hazelnut latte (one of their special flavors) , my brother got tiramisu as well. All were amazing but I think the latte was my favorite. The server was also very friendly and willing to give several samples so I also tried pumpkin cheesecake and irish coffee crunch. If I were to go back I would get the coffee crunch. All in all very lovely gelato in the heart of SF!
author: Jessica H.

description: 2flavors are always there: pistachio & gianduia (chocolate & hazelnut). Available in 3 sizes. Staff were friendly and so helpful. Sampling is highly encouraged. We tried almost all the flavors just because they were all so good. I finally settled on pistachio & fresh peach. So happy to find this little place of yumminess!
author: Lin L.

description:
Honestly, this is he best experience I've ever had at a gelato shop. That doesn't sound like much because a gelato purchase is generally very simple, but the service was incredible. The lady behind the counter gave us a sample of LITERALLY every flavor, without even having to ask! She gave us her recommendations and what the best ice cream combos are. 

Aside from this, the ice cream was SO GOOD!!!! It was rich and creamy, and not icy or watery flavored at all. Im not normally a fan of chocolate ice cream but the one here is my favorite!!! It tastes like straight up Nutella, the best. The pictures honestly don't do it justice. It tasted so incredibly fresh flavorful, I'm definitely coming back when I'm in the Area.
author: Alejandra A.

description: Best gelato in SF! The flavors are always changing and are never boring. I had the chocolate hazelnut + mint chip and both were such a creamy consistentcy and packed full of flavor. Worth stopping by if you're in the area.
author: Lauren R.

description:
ice cream is life! at least for my life! 
so i knew that being in SF i had to. had to. had to get ice cream or gelato. best part of any trip is exploring a new place. 

so with the raving reviews that coletta had i told the hubby lets go. 

after sampling their flavors we ended up with...

ordered:
*salted butter - yum. good texture. great flavor. 
*cappuccino crunch - definitely tasted like cappuccino. if you like coffee flavored ice cream/gelato than this version is pretty good.

now you are probably curious about the low rating. well, service. i can't emphasize enough how important service is. we weren't greeted upon walking in. the staff was just rescooping the ice cream. no customers in sight except one sitting and eating his ice cream. so i had to ask if they allowed samples. then as we sat there eating our ice cream i noticed how different the staff treated incoming customers. i didn't get an explanation of the menu flavors or recommendations. i just couldn't help but notice the difference and it bugged me. so, therefore coletta is 3 stars from this yelper. 

tips:
*indoor seating only
*allows samples
*no wifi/no outlet
*street parking
*restroom available 
*cash/credit card accepted
author: Lisa D.

description:
The gianduja and pistachio take me straight back to Italy 5/5 creamy and delicious.

The rest of the flavors seem a bit weak in comparison: worse texture, some a bit too sweet, etc.

But I'm still giving them 5/5 because of how damn good those two flavors are.
author: Kartik S.

description:
I got the horchata flavor, which was great taste-wise but a little too runny in terms of consistency. After trying some of their other flavors, I find the gelato here is definitely a bit too sweet for me. Plus the waffle cones were underwhelming, not flavorful at all.

However, service was good and the person behind the counter was kind enough to let us in a little before 1 PM, their official opening time.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Gelato here was bomb dot com! The girl who helped with the samples was very friendly as well.

You can really taste the quality of the gelato here and the flavors are totally on point!

A great place for a cold treat to satisfy you sweet tooth!

Give this place a try if you haven't already, you will not regret it!
author: Steven H.

description:
A taste of Italy in San Francisco! After eating my weight in gelato on my North to South Italy trip in 2017, I must say Coletta definitely stands up to the best gelatos I've tried overseas.

A small, simple shop with classic and high-quality flavors. I opted for the Mint and Chocolate gelato, Mint as a refresh and the Chocolate to see how rich and decadent it was. Plus Mint Chocolate is always a promising combination. The mint tasted great, pure mint flavor, lightly mentholated and tasted great in contrast to the Chocolate. The Chocolate was incredibly rich, lovely roasted flavor with much depth. The flavors were high-quality, with no artifical subtleties what so ever. No bizarre food coloring for the mint. The texture was on point with the signature gelato texture and creaminess. Yummy sugar cone, but the gelato at Coletta is definitely the star here.

Definitely a must try if you're in the area looking for a sweet treat! Probably one of the best gelato spots I've had in the US.
author: Janet N.

description:
I was on my way to another dessert shop by drove by Coletta and decided gelato was a better option. 

Tried three flavors:
Late harvest peach: consistency was grainy and there wasn't much of a peach flavor

Horchata: creamy and well balanced

Watermelon mint: I'm a little bit bias since I love all things watermelon, but we ended up getting a pint of this to share. Great watermelon flavor despite being a bit choppy in consistency (but you're not going to get a smooth consistency using watermelon anyway) 

Flavors are on the sweet side, but it's worth a stop if you're in the area and can find parking
author: Rachelle T.

description:
I hate that I moved to SOMA.
I hate that ice cream means wasted calories.
And I hate that Coletta is now 3 blocks away.

It takes more energy for me to NOT walk here and grab a scoop or two. 

Mint chip, coffee, you name it. Everything here is good.

The only solution I've resorted to: bringing home pints of Coletta. Less energy spent on remorse and the ice cream is easily accessible. Win-win for all!
author: Vee B.

description:
Mmm gelato! Not just gelato - but real Italian gelato! This place beats ANYTHING you could get in Little Italy/North Beach.

My husband and I were walking home from his work a few months ago and stopped by here on a particularly warm day in SOMA. There were no other patrons so they let us try almost all of the flavors before we settled on a small cup with half pistacio half hazelnut (my pick and his pick). There is a small counter and a cute bench outside for enjoying our treat. You can definitely tell how great the ingredients are with each bite and I definitely felt like I was transported back to Italy. 

There is a punch card for free gelato if you are a frequent flier but I keep loosing them! The lady said we can combine the punch cards if we find them. They also sell pints to take home. Definitely my favorite ice cream joint (and right by where we live! How dangerous!).
author: Michele L.

description:
Decent gelato - my go-to gelato flavors are usually stracciatella and pistachio so I went straight for those. Stracciatella was good. Pistachio didn't really taste anything like pistachio to me, it wasn't bad but I can't put my finger on what it tasted like. It just didn't have that rich deep pistachio nutty flavor that I've found at other gelato places. 

This seems to cater to the businesses around the area so if I worked around here I would come back but it wouldn't be worth the trek otherwise.
author: Queena T.

description:
Joey Gelato!!!  You are the man! He's the owner and he helped us choose the best flavor combos yesterday. I tried a few but settled on the medium size with Orea Cookie Mint and Salted Bourbon Caramel. Those were the two on the Specials menu at the time. I wasn't totally sure they would compliment one another but holy smokes, they were good! The other folks who came with me chose Orange Chocolate, Pumpkin Cheesecake, and the Salted Bourbon Caramel... Everyone was super happy with their choices. 

I love the helpfulness of the staff and owner and the chance to try all the flavors first! 

PRO TIP! The staff woman who was also helping was super nice, and she served one of our group. Then Joey Gelato (owner) came over and helped the rest of us. The serving size from Joey was literally twice as big as the serving that the other woman served up. I mean the cup wasn't very large and the gelato soared twice as tall as the height of the cup. HERE IS THE TIP... Get Joey Gelato to serve you, because he piles it on high!
author: Evan C.

description:
Despite working only two blocks from Coletta Gelato, I had never stopped in before last week... I was missing out. 

Coletta Gelato is wonderful. I sampled a few of their flavors before making my selection and they were all delicious. My pick? Cookie Coconut. Incredible! The staff was super friendly and there was no line when I went in around 3 PM. I will definitely return when in need of a sweet afternoon pick-me-up!
author: Katie C.

description:
BEST GELATO I'VE EVER HAD. Point blank. PERIOD.
I chose two flavors: pistachio and black sesame. Both were sooooo deliciously creamy. The pistachio was my favorite -- anything nutty, I like. :D 
The black sesame was an interesting flavor. Make sure you give this one a taste! Tbh, I chose this flavor because I was feeling adventurous and the black color drew me in. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯  
Would I get this flavor again? Probably not, just because I prefer other flavors, but it wasn't a bad flavor. 

Customer service was amazing. There was only one employee working, but she was super quick and patient with my indecisive group. 

If you find yourself in this area, make sure you stop here! You're welcome. :)
author: Liana B.

description:
It was my lucky day today as I went in and the gelato chef himself gave me a comprehensive background of each gelato flavor...after the tasting the samples, I purchased the largest size of pistachio, chocolate hazelnut and orange chocolate!! I got a little bonus gelato .. an unpublished flavor.. when i first tasted the pistachio, i couldn't believe how rich the flavor was. The peach gelato from what the chef shared was literaly from pure peaches.. Stone fruits are in season, so if you can't digest dairy, i highly recommend it!

The service was great, I can tell the chef put his passion into what he makes.. it's so hard to find great places in SF where there is so much love being put into the product.

They also cater to businesses....

Thank you for a great experience... time to eat my gelato now!
author: Suzie Y.

description:
A really cute gelaterias, Coletta Gelato has unique flavors and such an asthetic environment that I love stopping by here when I'm in the area.
Its always clean with friendly staff, with delicious vegan options. I just wish they had a larger menu!
author: Kelsi N.

description:
I saw that this place had 5 stars on Yelp so I HAD try it out! It's conveniently located in SOMA near a bunch of tech offices as well as MOMA. 

I got the caramel (as always) and was not disappointed. It's not overly sweet like some other places, and the consistency of the gelato was also perfectly creamy. They also had other flavors that were more unconventional, and I'd definitely recommend trying them even if you end up sticking with a basic flavor like I did.

If you check in, you get a free mini cone! Which is actually a good deal, especially if you're like me and can't handle too much gelato at once. You can also vote on the next flavor they should bring to the store, which is an awesome touch!
author: Priscilla S.

description:
Has been nice to see this place "grow up" so to speak as I believe I went here in their first opening weeks. 

Great customer service and great value. Two scoops runs you about $5

Went with:
Gianduja- Chocolate Hazelnut
Straciatella Italian Chocolate Chip

In particular I think these two flavors go well together b/c you get that chocolate / vanilla-ish balance that I enjoy in ice creams and baked goods.

Coletta has quickly established itself as one of the top frozen treat places in the city

So many good ice cream/gelato/chocolate spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 

I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Polly Ann Ice Cream
5 Salt and straw
6 Chocolate Covered
7 Smitten Ice Cream
8 Teuscher Chocolate 
9 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
10 Over the Moon
11 The Ice Cream Bar
12 Coletta Gelato
13 Cako Creamery
14 Bi-Rite Creamery
15 San Francisco's Hometown Creamery 
16 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
17 Mitchells Ice cream
18 St. Francis Fountain
19 Z Cioccolato
20 Joe's Ice Cream
21 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
22 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
23 Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop
24 Recchiuti Confections 
25 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description: Who knew you could get such delicious gelato in the middle of SoMa. I ordered the Mascarpone flavor - so rich and creamy, it reminded me of Italy. We came right after dinner and I was quite full already, but after trying their flavors, I couldn't help but get a scoop. The chocolate hazelnut was also really great. Definitely worth a stop!!
author: Apoorva A.

description:
It was a rare very hot day in SF.I was walking from Caltrain to a business meeting on Harrison and made a stop at Coletta. I am not exaggerating when I say, this is the best Gelato I have ever had! 

The location is a tiny hole in the wall with no frills. There are only 8 flavors and the choices are the size and if you want it in a cup or a cone. Simple, just the way I like it. Super nice girl at the counter and she guided me to the dark chocolate mousse and Gianduja (chocolate hazelnut) in a cone. It was mind alteringly good, dense and rich in flavor!
author: Sunil R.

description:
Stopped by here after lunch and sampled both of their chocolate flavors (dark mousse and hazlenut). They were both so good that I ended up getting both . 

The dark mousse was rich and creamy and the hazlenut was the perfect amount of sweetness with little bits of hazlenut. Will definitely be back to try some of their other flavors.

One thing to note is that they open at 1! Didn't know that and had to wait for 15 min, but it was worth it.
author: Sarah K.

description:
I love this place! A coworker introduced Coletta to me when they first opened last year. Named after the owner's grandmother, this spot is homey and welcoming. Once you start to sample the different flavors, you'll see that every flavor was crafted with care.

I have tried the pistachio, hazelnut and chocolate sorbetto. Chocolate sorbetto doesn't have any milk in it, and in my experience is usually a little icy and lacking oomph. *Not this place* It was rich in chocolate flavor, decadent and so creamy in texture that you would not know it didn't have milk in it. Great for vegans (and those trying to be vegan but can't give up gelato ) and those who are lactose intolerant. I'm sad I no longer work in SF so my opportunities to enjoy this gem of a gelato shop are few. If you find yourself in the SOMA district, this place is a must!
author: Joyce L.

description:
I was so excited to come here, I accidentally arrived half an hour before it even opened! 

Nonetheless the gelato was great and the people who worked there were all super friendly and willing to let you try all the flavors. 

I ended up getting the cookie coconut and hazelnut chocolate, which was a great combination btw. I'm not sure what else I can ask from them when their gelato is creamy and flavorful. 

If you're in the area, it's definitely worth a stop!
author: Christine L.

description: Not exactly sure what all the hype is about - I mean, their gelato is DECENT; however, it isn't anything out of this world. I've tried some amazing gelato down in Mountain View - so when I tried the pistachio flavor at this one, I just couldn't get myself to say that this is one of the best desserts I've tried! I probably won't come back, but it was a good experience.
author: Angelina H.

description:
TRY: the PISTACHIO GELATO!!!

Coletta is a charming little shop that packs some BIG flavors into its creamy gelato! Free samples, so browse around to find your favorite. Very friendly service. 10/10 WOULD GET GELATO HERE AGAIN.
author: Ming Y.

description:
This shop is pretty quaint and cute. The shop can only fit so many people in the store, so you may see a line out the door (it goes by quick).

I had the pistachio and it was pretty amazing. Not that sweet, which I really appreciated. I don't want its sweetness to overcome its flavor. My friend had the pineapple and it was refreshing. Perfect flavor. 

I wouldn't say the gelato was life changing, but it was pretty damn good.
author: Regine D.

description:
My favorite gelato place. The founder and stuffs are all very friendly and let me try different flavors before I decide.

They have several permanent flavors and few seasonal flavors rotating. My personal favorite is pistachio. I remember once they had a turmeric flavor which is super delighting and tasteful. Looking forward to their new seasonal flavor every month.
author: Wenjing Y.

description: Coletta Gelato, you've made it as one of my frozen treat faves!! So many great flavor offerings that I wish I had another stomach! There was almond gelato and hazelnut chocolate that I would've loved trying, but settled for the dark chocolate mousse and strawberry sorbet. It was a great combination! The sweetness and slight tartness of the strawberry sorbet mixed with a rich, luscious dark chocolate. Mmmm mmmm mmm!! My mouth is watering just thinking about it!
author: Aimee I.

description:
One of the best gelato places I've been to. And thank god for being in San Francisco! Highly recommend the chocolate hazelnut and pistachio. They keep changing flavours so you can always try something new.
Great people and service! A really cute place with a must try gelato. Don't miss!
author: Ashish S.

description:
This place is amazing.  Precious was so informative and helpful giving us information on all the flavors and allowing samples to test out what we want to get.  Her suggestions were also spot on!  
I Hope the ice cream quality never change!  The aroma of each flavor from every bite that melts in my mouth is so memorable that I find myself constantly thinking about going back for more.  

Gianduia (chocolate with hazelnut) and the Pistachio flavors compliments each other very well.  Their coffee flavor is good but after half the ice cream is gone, the other flavors have already drown the coffee taste.  However, the Gianduia and Pistachios keeps refreshing each other's flavor once you take nibble of one and then the other. MM.. I'd totally take other people here and recommend this ice cream joint.  

This is my favorite ice cream place so far.  Will definitely be back for more!  

Precious is so diligent helping us that she even helped us even when she was closing and trying to close.  Thanks Precious.  We are very grateful of your recommendations, suggestions and amazing service and generosity with the samples.  You get a check in sample when you check in yelp people!  Don't forget to check-in at this spot!  

Side Note: The lady on the chair in the wall painting is kind of creepy at night :D
author: Juila L.

description:
My husband and I have had gelato in many many places that boast of top awards like Venchi (italy) and Bela gelateria (Vancouver) - we a e clearly obsessed with gelato 

We always craved for that kinda place in San Francisco and our desire is now fulfilled - Thank you Coletta! 

Favorite and highly recommended flavors are chocolate hazelnut and pistachio.
author: Eshita S.

description: A must go Gelato in sf! To be honest my favorite is dark chocolate mousse which is super rich and smooth. I mixed it with famous chocolate&hazelnut and it only cost $5. Pistachio is good too, I should try every flavor
author: Yiming G.

description: Such kind people! Cute little shop. Really appreciate the way they went above and beyond. We love Coletta!
author: Betty Blue B.

description:
Yes, yes, and more yes. Fatten me up with Coletta Gelato and roll me around in a wheelbarrow if necessary.

Every single flavor I've tried, both fruit and milk-based, has been great (shout out to local inspiration like the Samovar Pumpkin Chai), but you MUST MUST get the Gianduia. It's chocolate hazelnut heaven with pieces of Ferrero Rocher. I'm not even a chocolate ice cream person but now every time I have to get this + another flavor (btw you can get 2 flavors in a small).

Maybe somehow I missed it or it's new, but they also have "paninos" - helloooo cold ice cream in a warm brioche bun. Ya'll know what I'm getting on my next visit, right?

You can find the founders scooping, and they are delightful. They went to Gelato University in Italy (who knew that was a thing?!). I've had gelato in Italy on a couple trips, and while it's been a minute and there might be some recency bias at play, I'm about 95% sure that at least the Gianduia is better than anything I had in Italy.

While nearby some sites, there isn't much going on in the neighborhood, so kudos to them for opening up shop here. This area can def use some love. 

Don't forget to vote for new flavors on the chalkboard on your way out!
author: Cristina S.

description:
Some coworkers told me about this place a couple of blocks from work so nothing beats a team building event! 

Very cute shop, lots of people line up so you know it's good. The staff is friendly and the decor is very inviting. The menu is super easy, choose either a waffle cone or cup, 1 (piccolo) or 2 (grande) scoops. The flavors seems to change on a daily and you can sample as many as you want. 

On this particular visit, I go a piccolo scoop of gianduia on a waffle cone. Gianduia is their chocolate hazelnut and let me tell you, WOW! The flavor was so rich and flavorful. I wished it wouldn't end. I can see why people love this place so much!

As the place evolves, I love that the place also includes an audience poll blackboard. Some new flavor concepts are listed and your job is to put a tally on the flavor you like. You never know, it might be a future feature flavor! If you're in the area, you've gotta come check them out!
author: Rockne H.

description:
I'm generally a little hesitant in trying the chocolate flavor when I visit an ice cream place for the first since it usually tastes the same everywhere and I prefer to get a sense of the specials at the store in question. 

I visited Colleta on a Wednesday afternoon with a couple of friends, one of whom is a regular. He suggested picking any flavor from the menu and was sure I was gonna love it. Taking his word for it, I got the medium sized cup that comes with 2 scoops of ice cream - Pistachio and Chocolate Hazelnut. 

The price was a little on the higher side but the ice cream was really creamy and left me feeling refreshed on a rare warm San Francisco afternoon. 

Maybe my method of judging an ice cream parlor needs changing where in I try the chocolate flavor everywhere and pick my favorites. Anyways .. Highly recommend!
author: Gaurav K.

description:
Walked by this little shop by accident one day and thought about going but there was a large crowd inside and I'm not able waiting. Came back another time with some friends and got to try some. The gelato is very smooth, normally when I get gelato it's quite dense like the one from Marco Polo. 

The flavors the day I went seemed pretty average but the flavors were intense. The passion fruit was sour and I loved it. We ended up getting the mint chocolate and the mint flavor really cuts through. It was like sucking on a mint leaf, it lingered for awhile kind of like when you get a mint. It was refreshing. I hope the next time I come back they have the black sesame. 

Nearby the door there's a black board with a bunch of flavors and customers get to put a mark next to the flavors they want so hopefully I can get that black sesame flavor next time I'm in the city.
author: Andrew T.

description: I really, really enjoyed this gelato. The hazelnut chocolate flavor emulated the taste and texture of a Ferrero Rocher perfectly. I was blown away. I also had a scoop of horchata which was likewise very tasty. This was one of the more memorable gelato places I've been to in SF. It's a shame that the location is kinda out of the way for me.
author: Michael S.

description:
I found this place from a picture on instagram. I've had this bookmarked for months. Unfortunately, they were closed the days I'd get a chance to visit the city. But not this time, yay! My intuition told me this gelateria was not going to disappoint unlike so many others before. It's difficult stateside establishments to get gelato right. I don't know how complicated the process can be only the end results. 

I already knew what my flavor combination was going to be dark chocolate and pistachio. I had to battle traffic coming from North Beach to get here and was praying those flavors would be available. I'm one lucky girl the store was open on a weekend and they had my flavors! The dark chocolate was super smooth despite being a sorbet. For some reason, I always think of sorbets as icy in texture. Oh and combine the dark chocolate with the pistachio, the stars aligned! It was magical! I actually was going to get another cup or cone but the husband stopped me. I told him gelato is healthier than any other ice cream I eat hahah but I lost the battle.

I'm glad I was able to stop by today! I don't know when I will be back but if you're in the area go as much as you can. I'll be envious from 30 miles away!
author: April L.

description:
Big fan of this tasty little shop and their tiny little cups so I don't feel as guilty about indulging in this deliciousness.

For those who aren't a big fan of the creamy, heavier, flavors the strawberry is deliciously light and flavorful. Obsessed with both the pistachio and the gianduia (which is basically nutella and everything good in this world). 

Love the board where people can vote on new flavors. Sorry, Durian. You've been up there for a really lonf time and you ain't winning.
author: Nikki M.

description:
Legit five star business!!

Tried...

Pistachio
Chocolate peanut butter
Hazelnut

Everything tasted great.
The dark chocolate is the best.

Portion size is good, they aren't being cheap.

$5 bucks for a waffle cone plus two scoops of ice cream (you can mix and match) is a great deal.

Come to socal!
author: Steven M.

description:
This might be my favorite gelato spot in SF. The portions are generous, the waffle cones don't cost extra (I know, right??) and the flavors are spot-on. The employees are really friendly and patient with samples too.

When I came on a weekend, I saw numerous customers coming in and buying large portions of gelato (they sell small/large boxes of gelato). They just said which flavors they wanted, and the employees packed the gelato into the boxes for them. It's nice that you don't have to pick the prepackaged gelato flavors in the fridge, and that you can get large portions of the seasonal flavors if you want to take it home to share with your family or save for later snacking.

The interior of this location is pretty small, but it wasn't too crowded so I was able to sit inside and enjoy my gelato with my sister. I'll be back here again!
author: Theresa L.

description:
Get the pistachio!!! I had to write that first in case it's the only thing you read!

When we arrived, I didn't even bother to try anything and ordered my go-to flavors for whenever I get gelato or ice cream: chocolate hazelnut (here it's called gianduia) and cookies and cream. What a mistake! After all of my friends ordered and we got our gelato, I started sampling their flavors. I realized there were so many amazing flavors that I should have ordered instead. First off, I never bother with pistachio because it always tastes weird/fake (other times I've tried it), but it tasted like a real, fresh pistachio. The saffron was also really unique and delicious. And, of course, the dark chocolate was rich and indulgent.
author: Danielle A.

description:
Coletta Gelato is my new favorite gelato shop in San Francisco! The flavors are intense and rich and the consistency is wonderfully dense and creamy. This modern gelateria might be small, but they pack a big punch! 

Giandiuia almost changed my life. After I got through the pronunciation, I couldn't get over how it tasted like a ferrero rocher ball coming to life in wintertime. Chocolate and hazelnut heaven. 

Coconut cookie was also incredible.

The owners are literally masters at their craft and were trained in Italy. And to top it off, they're personable and friendly and care about customer input. 

Coletta Gelato is where it's at. I've been thinking about them ever since my first visit and can't wait to go back. Even though they're a little out of the way in SoMa, they're definitely worth a visit!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
Another incredible ice cream shop to open in SF! You can pretend you're in Italy for just a moment, tasting this rich, creamy smooth gelato. The flavors rotate regularly, but they have my favorite - nocciola or hazelnut - among other flavors including sorbet. I opted for the strawberry sorbet last time on a warm afternoon and thoroughly enjoyed it.

There used to be a crêperie in this location, so I'm used to coming here for sweets and this gelateria has quickly slid into my top dessert places in the city. 

We met one of the owners and he studied at the Gelato University in Italy to learn the tricks of the trade. If you're looking for fabulous, authentic gelato, it doesn't get much better than this!
author: Shira W.

description:
Wow, this spot is great!

I've been here twice and their Gianduia (chocolate with hazelnut) is really great. It has pure, rich chocolate with that incredible flavor from the hazelnut. The texture of their gelato is perfect - rich and creamy. They have a ton of other flavors to try so I'm looking forward to frequent trips back!
author: Ken G.

description:
I've been so eager to come to another ice cream shop just to add one in my top ten favorite ice cream companies.  Of course, I wanted to try their many different ways on how to make frozen treats.  I wanted to believe Coletta Gelato is the last ice cream shop in SF, but Xanath is still a big hit with its original taste of vanilla.  Looking at Coletta on my first visit, its interior smaller and cuter than Xanath.  The decor of this cute little shop was even more inviting.  I usually thought the line was big; however, I came here even later with just one or few customers in line.  Another cute feature is a Bambino holding a small scoop of amaretto, just how I pictured it!  I know there are many random flavors like black sesame, not as much as Naia Gelateria.  I'm expecting more from Coletta Gelato; in another visit.

By the way, gotta love the color of that styrofoam takeout containers.  They look compostable!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Coletta Gelato is smooth, creamy, and flavorful! Love the fact that you get to sample different flavors before purchasing your fair share of gelato. Their flavors are often changing, but they provide a suggestion board to help you pick your flavor(s). We got the mango, pistachio anatolia, milk tea, and hazelnut. The flavors were all so delicious and refreshing! We enjoyed it a lot. The staff was super friendly, helpful, and patient. Giving their daily suggestions as well. The shop is small with a few seats inside and out if you wanted to stick around. Overall, Colette Gelato is delish! 

AS ALWAYS, NOM FOR LIFE!
author: Natasha N.

description: I've been here a few times and the staff is always so friendly! They're always so patient- esp with someone like me who has to try almost every flavor they have, but I always end up gravitating towards the coffee gelato. Their gelato is sooo creamy. Today I got a free mini cone just for checking in on Yelp! :)
author: Fahren F.

description:
Loved, loved, loved this spot.
I came in on a hot San Francisco day in the middle of Autumn and a cone of gelato was a must have.

The shop is small but they try to utilize as much of their space they can for seating. There's some stool seats inside, a bench in front and some outdoor tables and chairs in front of the driveway. 

The gelato itself had the perfect consistency and texture I was looking for. Dense, creamy and smooth. No air bubbles. It utterly just melts in your mouth. I don't remember the names in Italian but I got one scoop of the hazelnut/chocolate (taste like Fererro Rocher omg amazing) and another of the pistachio/almond (also amazing!). Got it on a waffle cone and ate every bit of it.

One con would be the limited amount of flavors. If I remember it was around 8ish choices. They make it fresh in store everyday (I'd assume) while rotating flavors but less than a lot of gelato shops I've been to. But again like I said, very small shop so it's reasonable.

Overall, great place. Good gelato. Cute ambiance. Good customer service, and try some flavors if you'd like they seem more than happy to!
author: Joselyne T.

description:
I've had three encounters with Coletta now: twice I went to their SOMA location and once I had the pleasure of tasting their goods at a Yelp event. And I have to say: I'm a big fan!

Normally, I'm actually a guy who likes their ice cream chunky: the more different crunchy things in it, the better: think Ben & Jerry's Americone. Coletta Gelato, on the other hand, is quite puritan...but oh so tasty. Their pistachio flavor is so good, that I could've eaten a whole pint. And today, I fell in love with their almond gelato...heavenly. 

I sure hope I get to enjoy many more encounters with the folks at Coletta Gelato!
author: Uli B.

description: Everytime I drive home from Chinatown, I have to drive down Harrison Street and if there's parking nearby, it means I need to get some gelato. I've never been disappointed with a flavor I've gotten, and they usually have a good mix available each day of adventurous and simple flavors. Texture is great as well, and quite unlike any other gelato I've had. You won't be disappointed!!
author: Daisy Y.

description:
I was walking by and saw a sign for gelato. It's funny how old fashioned advertising works so well because I immediately started looking for it.

The shop is cute and artsy. The line was probably 5 min - not bad at all. The lady was pretty nice about letting us sample some flavors. We got the hazelnut + chocolate, mango, and stracciatella. The flavor is rather rich but not overwhelmingly so. It's not too sweet either! I chowed down on it pretty quick. Highly recommended!!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
My team and I were craving a sweet treat on a hot afternoon and decided to embark on an adventure for some gelato to help cool us down! Once we got inside, we were greeted by the friendly staff and cute decor. I was also ecstatic that the special flavor of the week was Milk Tea (I'm a huge boba fanatic and try to drink every chance I get if you didn't know!). 

Ordered the Milk Tea & Stracciatella and it was a splendid combination. The Milk Tea flavor tasted like the actual drink and I couldn't get enough. The Stracciatella was also tasty thanks to the generous portions of chocolate chips. I was able to devour my two scoops and waffle cones within minutes. Guilty but worth it!

I'm looking forward to visiting again to see the other special flavors they have to offer. It's quite dangerous that Coletta is within walking proximity from my work office!
author: MyTien P.

description:
The REAL DEAL! I just geeked out on their website and learned that the owners went to legit gelato school in Italy. And yes, this is the closest thing to Italian gelato that I've tasted in the bay. The texture is so perfectly soft, and the flavors are dense and intense. 

It's a tiny shop, with a few spots to sit and eat. Great place to grab a scoop and stroll. It's $5 for a small cup, you get 2 flavors and the servings are overflowing. The Gianduia (hazelnut-chocolate) is like frozen nutella... hits the spot when you need your dessert fix.
author: Nique F.

description:
THE BEST GELATO OF MY LIFE

I asked them to taste three flavors: milk tea, almond, and passion fruit. All of them were so amazing i just had to have all three and ordered a grande just for myself and finished it all.

If i have to choose, almond was my favorite but all of them were seriously amazing!!! They have very big portions for a gelato place too. I was pretty sure I wouldn't be able to finish a grande after realizing how high they stack it for you. But then I finished it lol

I thought i had really good gelatos before but this place is just over the top. 

It was a bit crowded because i went after a giants game and a lot of ppl also came from the game but it's not located in the busiest place in sf so I don't imagine it being so crowded all the time. 

They do catering too so if you are doing events you can hire? Them for the whole day.

GOING BACK TO THIS PLACE NO MATTER WHAT!!!!!!
author: Yeonhwa S.

description: Delicious gelato without the hefty price! 2 flavors in a waffle cone is only $5, aka unheard of in SF. Bonus points for having easy street parking and being open on the weekends! Highly recommended!
author: Emily C.

description: I don't know honestly what I have been doing without reviewing Coletta on Yelp. I could give Coletta 6 stars if I could. Such a warm place to get your gelato from. The gelato here is so good that I decided to make a documentary on Coletta Gelato. Henri and Antonio are the warmest people you would ever meet. Every so often when they post there is a new flavor, I am there to give it a try. No matter how many flavors I try the staff never gets pissed off. They always hand over the gelato with a great smile. I bring all my friends here so they can taste the goodness too.
author: Sailaja B.

description:
I was introduced to this quaint little gelato shop by fellow Yelper Tiffany Z.  It's fairly close to our office in SOMA, so walking there is really convenient.  The interior is nicely decorated and the staff were really friendly.  I found myself staring at the selections in front of me and paused to figure-out which flavors I wanted to order.  I must say it was quite a dilemma and even sampled a few flavors thinking it would help me make a decision.  Unfortunately, it just made my decision harder, since all the flavors I sampled were really good.  

Tiffany ordered a scoop of the Giandvia and Speculoos in a small cup.  I ordered the Stracciatella and Mango in a small cup.  I was really pleased when I saw how much we got in a small cup.  My Stracciatella was creamy and had the right amount of chocolate that I was looking for.  The Mango was really nice and I enjoyed it very much.  

I noticed they had a suggestion board, where customers can write-down pretty much any flavor(s) they'd like to see.  I really found that to be a really cool touch, since I think it helps engage your customers who are supporting your business.  Do yourself a favor and enjoy a few scoops if you need to cool-down or need a well deserved treat.
author: Lon H.

description: Their peach flavor is the best. Highly recommend!!!!It tastes like real peach. I also get chocolate hazelnut and sea salt peanut butter. There was giant hazelnut in the ice cream. But the sea salt peanut one was too salty  will come again!!
author: Putin J.

description: Probably the best strawberry sorbet I've had. The sorbet is all natural made from fresh strawberries. I also did the pistachio gelato, and in most places pistachio essence is used which can be very strong and artificial. This actually tasted very natural and refreshing!
author: Poornima S.

description:
Small shop located on Harrison with fantastic Gelato. The flavors are varied and prices fair with two generous scoops $5. 

They let you try samples and were very patient as we had a hard time choosing. Our selection:

Guava - I was expecting a fruit sorbet but this was surprisingly creamy and rich with a strong guava flavor.  So good!

Pistachio - one of their most popular flavors.  I like pistachios but I haven't had it often as ice cream or gelato. Again, rich, creamy and an intense gelato flavor. 

Overall great stop.  Friendly service, good prices, and top notch Gelato.  Flavors are so good and such good quality.  

Coletta accepts credit cards including American Express.
author: Randy F.

description:
Good gelato. I really liked the coconut cookie and the chocolate flavors. This place doesn't have room to sit and barely any room to stand, hence the missing 5th star. They also are open for a few hours after lunch, so that's a miss. 

Don't have a lot of variety which helps with the selection. But they have Apple Pay!
author: Arjan N.

description:
Amazing workers. I came in with some friends on a Wednesday afternoon and the worker was nothing but friendly and kind to us. I would come back just for her. 

But on that note, the gelato is incredible. Wonderful texture and thickness, very big scoops, and always-changing flavors. You can even suggest your own! I bought the Gianduia (chocolate hazelnut) and some coffee flavor (can't remember which one). 

They don't use normal ice cream scoops, just a paddle so they can fill your waffle cones to the top.
author: Debbie N.

description:
Strong delicious flavors in light texture, yet with a hint of cream. Taste so refreshing and natural. Not too sweet either. I love that there isn't a long line here. 

Why don't they just charge $30 for the large box of ice cream so it's like getting one free order of cream for the large order?
author: Gloria T.

description:
Can't ruin their perfect 5 star review. Seriously good gelato and amazing flavors. Their chocolate hazelnut/Nutella/if-you-wanna-be-fancy-gianduja is amazing and it has delicious crunchy nuts and crispy wafers. It tastes better when it melts, too!

Side note-I'm a big coffee flavor fan but their coffee crunch flavor wasnt compelling. Liked the crunchy coffee beans but flavor was too sweet rather than strong.
author: Ke C.

description:
THANK YOU NOAH! and the Coletta Gelato team! My wife & I had our wedding last week and when we were planning, we did NOT want the traditional cake. We witnessed it too many times--- cakes cut late in the evening when half the guests have already departed, only for the serving staff to collect and waste it all! We said no thanks to waste and no thanks to cake cutting fee. We wanted something delicious, would not go to waste and fit a summer time wedding and gelato was the perfect answer! We worked with Noah from the beginning and throughout (but sadly did not even get to meet the Gelato Man himself) and he was professional, prompt with his responses and provided very delicious gelato! 

Noah was very punctual with his arrival to our wedding. We ordered 3 cool boxes, which totaled 300 mini-servings for 185 people, not including our vendors. They also have a cruiser which serves I think 400 mini-servings. We had some leftovers, but mainly because our guests were too polite to get up during toasts. After the toasts, the lines were non-stop! Everyone raved about the gelato! We had dark chocolate mousse, strawberry sorberto, pistachio, black sesame, Irish cream and banana coco rum-- YUM!! I'm not a huge fan of overly sweet desserts and the ones I was able to try (chocolate, strawberry, pistachio and Irish cream) were the right amount of sweetness for me-- you can actually taste more than just sweet! The pistachio was also very unique because it really tastes like you're eating an actual pistachio!! Why are you still reading this--- head over and try a scoop or 2 (or more- highly encourage), buy a pint (also recommended) and take home or cater them at your wedding/event (also highly recommend)!
author: Danny T.

description:
I have become slightly lactose intolerant in my old age so I don't eat a lot of dairy anymore. Lucky for me, Coletta has some of the most delicious fruit forward seasonal sorbets I've ever tasted. Scoops like strawberry, pear, lemon, mango, grapefruit. I love them all. Currently, I'm semi-addicted to strawberry.

On occasion, I will cheat and try a scoop of gelato as well. If you're going to break anywhere, this is the place to frickin do it. The Gianduja makes me tear up a bit. It's so good, a perfectly exemplary example of that flavor profile: chocolate, hazelnut, creamy in the right ways. Also, I recently had the Horchata and it was to die for -- I ate way too much of its but the taste memories I formed were worth it.

Every time I walk into Coletta I feel like family. I'm always greeted so warmly and my questions (I usually have quite a few) are always answered graciously.

Coletta is great for an after lunch palate cleanser or mid-afternoon snack, or late night after dinner, or really whenever. Mmmmm.
author: David B.

description: This was by far the best gelato I've ever had. I'm a huge hazelnut fan so I tried the gianduia (gianduja) and was blown away. So much so that this is my second time here this week. The staff is also incredibly kind and extremely generous with their portions. I will definitely be recommending this to all my friends.
author: Wayne C.

description: Tried their strawberry sorbet and I could tell they used a lot of strawberries to make it, so I was happy about that! Some sorbets have an icy texture to it but this one was smooth. If you're craving something light and refreshing, this is definitely something you should try! One of the better sorbets I've had.
author: Joey W.

description:
BUTTER. Okay, maybe not butter, whipped cream? It was the lightest fluffiest gelato in the mot perfect way. I went with the gianduia (hazelnut, basically). The smallest size looks puny, laughable. I went with the medium size. It was pretty rich; I could've (should've*) gone with the small. So I ended up with more ice cream than I need, woe is me. 

Also! Checking in gets you a small cone. I thought I was getting a small cone. Wrong. I got a small cone, filled with gelato. I think I've peaked. It doesn't get any better than this.
author: Trang B.

description: Speechless. Never had better gelato. You just have to go to experience the crazy goodness! I had pistachio! Mmmmmmmmmm!!!!!!
author: Michelle B.

description: Coletta's catered our wedding welcome party in August up in Sebastopol. They were awesome! Throughout the booking process they were super responsive and easy to work with! Noah helped us to create a special flavor (a really strong coffee flavored java chip). The set up with the cool carts was convenient and unobtrusive and the service was great. Most importantly their gelato is exceptional! We had pistachio, java chip, mango sorbetto and giaduja. At the end of the event they packed up the leftovers for us to take home. I highly recommend Coletta's catering for any event and would definitely use them again!
author: Christina S.

description:
Wowowowow. I'm so happy Coletta is in SOMA. So close to my work building, too! Gelato is always so good for the soul.  This place exemplifies wonderful customer service, a great owner, and different flavors every month. There are a couple of flavors to pick from and you're more than welcome to sample them as well, awesome. Their Gianduia flavor is really bomb, a hazelnut/chocolate flavor.  Every time I sample one of their flavors I always just run into 1 problem: not knowing which 2 flavors to pick. 
This is a great gelato shop in SF, highly recommend if you're craving for a fix on a hot day, or even any time of the week day!
author: Tiffany Z.

description:
Coletta Gelato is a fairly new gelato shop that recently opened its doors in SoMa, and I'm a HUGE fan. The area nearby is not the cleanest/safest, but you can't miss it due to the adorable gelato mural outside. The interior is decorated extremely well, not unlike a very hipster, millennial coffee shop. The space is pretty small, but it's definitely utilized well--it has window seating, a table, a few bookshelves, etc.

The gelato here is ridiculously velvety; this might be my new favorite gelato shop in the whole Bay Area. It's delicious, rich, and bursting with flavor! 

What I Ordered:

-one scoop of Gianduia (Hazelnut + Chocolate) and one scoop of Pistachio gelato (5/5): Holy wow, this was amazing. These flavors were both very intense, and I actually usually prefer fruity ice cream/gelato flavors, but the intensity wasn't overwhelming to my tongue. The gianduia reminded me of Ferrero Rocher, which is definitely not a bad thing, and the pistachio flavor was strong/nutty but not too sweet which was very appreciated.

I also want to take a second to commend the service here--in front of us was this giant group of two families combined, with a few screaming children, some moody teenagers, and two sets of tired parents. The worker that day (the owner?) took them on with a smile and a lot of patience, giving them as many samples and recommendations as they asked for. They also changed their minds a lot LOL and he didn't seem to mind one bit! It literally took 15 minutes to get through their order, but he moved on to me and my boyfriend right away with no hint of frustration or tiredness whatsoever. It was super impressive to witness! 

All in all, I will definitely be coming back here--sometimes, I feel like SoMa is sorely lacking in good dessert places and this spot has filled a hole in my heart. Swing by if you're in the area if you want to eat some 100% bona fide, rich, velvety, delicious gelato!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
Since we recently returned from a trip that Rome, I've been looking for a great place for gelato. It's not as common in the SF Bay Area, but given all the 5 star reviews of Coletta Gelato I was looking forward to giving it a try.

On a Saturday around 730PM, we were the only customers i.e. no line :) The scooper was really nice and said we could try as many flavors as we wanted. I would usually oblige especially since it was our first visit but I felt bad and stopped after trying 50% of all the flavors. My favorites were Pistachio, Gianduia (chocolate and hazelnut), and Peanut Butter. The quality, flavor and texture were amazing; it brought back fond memories of the best gelato we recently had in Rome.

Like most gelaterias in Rome, they don't charge extra for cones. Two flavor max for a small/piccolo ($5) in a cup or sugar cone, three flavors for a large/grande ($7) in a cup or waffle cone. The difference in cone, we were told, is because the sugar cone doesn't support the weight very well of a large serving. They also sell pints ($10).

While not located in an area I usually frequent in SF, Coletta Gelato is definitely worth the trek.
author: Lindsey C.

description:
Normally I'd pick ice cream over gelato just because ice cream shops tend to have more interesting flavors but Coletta Gelato sticks to the basics and does it extremely well. Plus the employees are friendly and parking isn't terrible (ok it's metered parking that can get tough but we got lucky and snagged a spot right around the corner). The store itself has a bench and 2 tables with a few seats.

For my picks I got the Fior di Latte & the Gianduia. The gelato had the perfect texture. They were both thick and luxurious but somehow not heavy at all. They were silky and creamy but also didn't melt immediately. Both flavors had the right amount of sweetness and all the ingredients came through very cleanly. The Fior di Latte let the milk itself shine through and it complemented the Gianduia well. The Gianduia is basically like a better Nutella and it had tiny wafer-like crisps throughout.

Overall I really love a gelato shop that can get everything done just right. If I'm in the area I'd definitely come back!
author: Vivian C.

description:
The best ice cream in the city!!! Instantly reminded me of Italy  
high quality
amazing price 
organic ingredients 

Thanks for lovely staff giving the best suggestions and opportunity to try flavors! If you want to try something new or to have the ice cream you love the most - this is #1 place to go!!!
author: Evelina K.

description:
Love that SOMA is welcoming more creameries. Coletta is definitely the sweet hearts of soma. Staff and owner was great, super friendly. Unique flavors. Different most days per the manager. Small space but there are some tables and seats if you wanted to eat in. 

Their most popular flavor is the "GIANDUIA" but I think it was way too sweet. It was good but I won't be to eat more than a few bites. I really like the ALMOND, it was my favorite and pistachio was good as well.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Friendly owner and staff, but everything else about this gelato shop was a disappointment.

1) Please learn how to scoop your gelato. It looks like someone dropped the ice cream. 

2) Stingy portion especially on the sugar cone. I advise you to get it in a cup if you want your money worth. 

3) Gelato flavors were rather boring and I didn't think it was spectacular. 

Overall, I'd skipped this place within a heartbeat. Life's too short to eat mediocre dessert!
author: Owie N.

description:
This place is probably one of the few if not the only legit gelato spot in SF. Their gelato is handcrafted and you can taste it. This is the closest gelato I've had in sf that can actually compare to an Italian gelato.

All of the flavors they make are delicious and you can't go wrong. 

Flavors that stood out to me:

- Gianduia 
- Stracciatella
- Pistacchio
- Almond
- Amaretto


Can't wait to go back !!!!


PS: for those who don't know, gelato is supposed to be creamy and moldable.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
So yummy. Great gelato for a warm day. Cone is free, so if you're extra hungry go grab it for your gelato. They regularly rotate their flavours around, so you'll probably get a new experience the next time you come back.

In my experience, the flavours that stand out are the nut flavours. The other ones, not so much. But I've had the pistachio and hazelnut flavours and those were excellent. Yummy in the tummy!
author: Desmond C.

description: I love Coletta! Their scoops are generous, their gelato is delicious, and they rotate their interesting flavors. This place is kind of hidden and small, but totally worth an afternoon stroll to for a mid day ice cream break! Their chocolate flavors are very rich! If you don't want something too heavy, stay away from those ones.
author: Olivia C.

description:
The gelato here is made in small batches and flavors change weekly. The consistency is smooth and rich and the flavors are interesting - same flavors at the Mission location. I was not a huge fan of most of the flavors except the gianduja and it was nice.

Perhaps I'm not a gelato person but I didn't think it was good enough to order a pint to go. However, I would recommend stopping by to try some fun gelato flavors, no line even on weekends!
author: Jess C.

description:
Coletta Gelato was a true find in SoMa. I was looking for a cool treat on a warm day and would have been fine with any port in the storm, but Yelp pointed me towards Coletta on my way to AT&T Park. Their small, but cute location is on Harrison and 3rd near the VA clinic.

The menu is focused on a limited number of high quality gelato with unique ingredients. On my trip, I chose the pistachio in a cone and was rewarded with a delicately flavored gelato with a luxurious texture. Samples are available for several options, although I did not see any particularly exotic flavors on my visit. The interior is modern and clean, but it lacks any real seating or waiting area.

Prices are rather high, but worth the quality and location. I was truly surprised by this find, and encourage you to enjoy it as well.
author: Kristian D.

description:
Amazing gelato ! I was craving ice cream, and coletta hit the spot ! Their selection of flavors are small, but they do rotate their flavors daily, with the gianduia and the pistachio offered all the time. The worker (did not get his name) was very friendly and  offered us many samples and his recommendations. 

My bf and I settled on their most popular flavors, the gianduia and pistachio. Very creamy and rich flavors. The smallest size is perfect. They have the big box sizes to bring home and even sell pre boxed pints. 

I love how they had a list by the door for you to put your flavor recommendations. I will definitely be back to try their other flavors. Best gelato I have tried. Every bite was heaven.
author: Wendy L.

description: Best gelato I've ever had in the US. Chocolate was dark, rich, and creamy. Gianduia (hazelnut) was incredible and full of sharp, nutty flavor.
author: Ian C.

description:
As I'm personally a big fan of gelato and prefer such to eating ice cream (which tends to be heavier & creamier), this place naturally got my interest. Stopped in just as one of SF's rare heat waves came roaring into the area & I'm glad I took a chance on this joint. Known for its quirky gelato flavors, some traditional & some with a California twist, this place deserves the high reputation that it has. 

Sizes are the following: 
Bambino $3.50 (1 flavor)
Piccolo $5 (2 flavors)
Grande $7 (3 flavors)
La 500 $18
La 1000 $35
Pint to go $8

This place seems to have some stable flavors & others that rotate regularly (milk based or sorbet). There's actually even a small chalkboard near the door where you can vote for the next flavor to rotate in, one getting the most votes showing up the next day. 

I got the CA Pistachio with Maldon sea salt, Almost Chai, and CA Almond and was pleased with all three of them. The gelato here is done quite well, perfect to taste, not too overpowering in sugar/flavor, and quite the delight to consume. That being said, you really can't go wrong with any flavor. Just be sure to sample before buying. Would highly recommend this gelato shop to anyone. A most worthy place to visit for this delectable Italian treat!
author: Jack M.

description:
The best gelato that's ever graced my taste buds :)

The flavors Coletta had when I went all sounded and really tasted delectable. Definitely go with friends so you can try more flavors but also know there's only a limited amount of seating in the store!

The owners really know their gelato and put a lot of attention to their craft. They have a suggestions list up front for new flavors because they churn their gelato in-house! 

I ended up getting two flavors in a small cup: pistachio and strawberry (v cute color combo) and they were both amazingly smooth, rich and decadent. Unlike a lot of gelato places I've been to, the flavors were not 'icy' or watered down at all! Just pure flavor bombs of velvety goodness in gelato form. Their nutty flavors in particular (gianduia, hazelnut and pistachio) are super creamy while their fruity flavors and green tea are creamy but slightly lighter. Definitely recommend getting two flavors in one cup so you don't get too bored of one flavor!

The cute little shop changes up their flavors often so I'll definitely need to keep coming back.
author: Annie P.

description:
The storefront is really cute but the space inside isn't too large either so it's more standing room to enjoy your dessert than a sit down area. 

They offer unique flavors and I'm really thankful they also have dairy-free flavors (mainly the sorbets) for those of us that are lactose intolerant! It seems that they also switch out the flavors pretty often. While I was there they had a poll on the wall on what their next flavor should be!
author: VyVy V.

description:
Coletta Gelato recently opened and I have been eyeing the shop. I decided today was the day. I sampled the peach sorbet, peanut butter and dark chocolate, and the Gianduia. The Gianduia is hazelnut based.

The peach sorbet had a refreshing light taste and the peanut butter and dark chocolate was similar to a peanut butter cookie.

I was torn and chose the Gianduia. I had, had 3 samples already and there were 2 people in line. So I decided to get Pistachio, even without sampling it. How daring! No seriously, pistachio  flavored ice creams/gelatos do vary greatly in taste and execution and can have an artificial off-putting flavor. 

I am so glad that I got the $5 small scoop of Gianduia and pistachio! Colette Gelato doesn't play around with artificial flavoring. The pistachio gelato had a concentrated nuttiness and I felt like I was unshelling and eating a handful of pistachios. Delicious!

My little sample spoon of Gianduia did not do justice to the experience of eating a whole scoop. To think I was almost not going to get this flavor. 

Boy the Gianduia is out of this world!! It tasted like the rich inside of a Ferro Roche. I really enjoyed that it also had little chips of hazelnut. These were like the inside crispy layer around the Ferro Roche core. The Gianduia has an amazing flavor and texture profile!

Coletta's gelatos are rich, smooth, and creamy. I am not normally a fan of hazelnut flavored products, but I am very impressed with the Gianduia. You can definitely tell that a lot of care and thought is put behind crafting their flavors. I cannot wait to come back! Until then, adieu.
author: Uma A.

description:
Prices:
Bambino $3.50 (1 flavor) 
Piccolo $5 (2 flavors) 
Grande $7 (3 flavors) 
La 500 $18
La 1000 $35
Pint to go $8

A perfect 5 stars in a city with superb food? This place absolutely deserves it. I've eaten my fair share of gelato. Actually, I've probably eaten more than my fair share. I've eaten it around the Bay Area, out of state, across Europe, and in its Italian homeland. This is the best gelato in the Bay Area. The flavors here include both traditional ones, but also some creative ones, and they appear to be on a rotating schedule. While the flavors here are rich and intense, it's the texture that really sets them apart. The gelato here is perfectly creamy and silky and dense without the slightest hint of iciness. Most gelaterias fall short on the texture for me, but I have no complaints about this one. I got a grande to split with my husband. We got the pistachio, Gianduia, and mulled spices, and were happy with all three. They have a bar with a few stools along the walls for seating, so don't expect to sit inside with your huge group of friends.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Cute little gelato place! This place is super new, location is a bit out of place, but worth the trip here. 

Every day they have new kinds of flavors. I got the Fier de Latte Gelato, it was quite delicious and smooth. I did sample the other flavors however they were a bit too sweet, therefore I picked the one that was less sweet. My boyfriend ordered the Gianduia, which was chocolate hazelnut, it was too sweet for him. 

They also have a board where you can write what flavors you would like to see in the future. Innovative fo sho.
author: Natalie L.

description:
ERMAGERD.

Came here today with my coworkers and it was amazing. I got a small cup of the hazelnut chocolate flavor, my coworkers got one small cup of the pistachio and the other coworker got cookie coconut and passion fruit.

Hazelnut chocolate is like eating light, creamy and rich ferrero rocher in gelato form. I've never had good gelato until today. The pistachio is very nutty. The cookie coconut is a good choice for people that like more tropical flavors.

Shop is very clean and service is straightforward.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Ice cream that tastes like drops of heaven. Had the crunchy cappuccino and hazel chocolate. It was just amazing. They also went out of their way to get NFC pay working so I can pay through the phone.
author: Mackie M.

description: Gelato isn't ice cream. It's in it's own category! This tiny shop on a super busy street is easy to miss, but you really shouldn't miss it if you love gelato! The Gianduia scoop I had was amazing, and if I had to describe it, it's exactly how everyone else has described: Ferrero Rocher ice cream. Delicious chocolate and hazelnut combined into one outstanding delicious treat. I would definitely be back here!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Came here twice already and this is definitely the best gelato place around! Their gelato has a smooth, creamy texture and all the flavors I've tried are spot-on. Super friendly staff and great environment. They switch flavors often and even have a flavor suggestion board.

First visit: 
They offered free Guiness flavored gelato in a small cone. I passed on this but everyone was saying that it tasted exactly how it sounds. Instead, I got Hibiscus Milk Tea and Hazelnut Queen (Nocciola Regina) in a piccolo/small ($5). The milk tea was unique and floral - it took a few licks to get used to since I've always been attached to the Asian milk tea flavors. Both flavors were really good!

Second visit:
This visit won me over. There were so many good flavors I wanted to get, and after sampling several with friends, I decided on a small cup of Pistachio and Basil. This was the best pistachio I had (and a staff favorite) - it's really rich and creamy in the right way. I was feeling a little adventurous with Basil because the sample was so good! It's not overpowering and complements well with another flavor (it's refreshing by itself too). 

Coletta Gelato, I'll see you again!!! :)
author: Sarina C.

description:
This place has overtaken every other gelato place in my repertoire as The Best Gelato I Have Ever Had. It's located a couple blocks away from central, touristy, fun parts of SF, but it's worth the short detour. My group and I went while it was raining, and it was still busy! My friend said that when she came last, there was a line stretching outside and down the block. 

The location is a bit small, but there are a few tables and chairs. If you can snag the chairs by the door, you can read through the "suggested flavors" list that various customers have added to while you enjoy your gelato. I highly recommend adding flavors yourself! My friends and I had fun thinking up different, unique flavors.

I'm a ferrero rocher lover, so no matter where I get gelato, giunduia (chocolate and hazelnut) is often my go-to flavor when it's available. I have to say that Coletta Gelato NAILED the perfect giunduia! It was rich, creamy, flavorful, and had the perfect level of sweetness. You're allowed to order half and half for every size (highly recommend this too). I ordered the giunduia and meyer lemon. The meyer lemon was tart and sweet and the perfect complement to the giunduia. The light the match the rich. 

From my friends', I was also able to try the pistaciom basil, and strawberry flavors. Every single one of them was AMAZING. I really don't know what to say beyond that.

The staff are super nice and friendly.

I know I'll be stopping by here again the next time I'm in SF!
author: Waverly R.

description:
My favorite Gelato spot in the city!! 

The interiors are cute, the staff are super friendly, and the Gelato is DA BOMB. 
I love the Strawberry sorbetto, gianduia (chocolate hazelnut), and almond!
I put in a request (on the chalkboard) for black sesame last time and they totally took that into consideration and made some when I went earlier this week!

Whenever I come here to get Gelato for office parties, the staff are super helpful! They give us spoons, cones, cups, and pack the gelato in these awesome biodegradable styrofoam boxes they imported from Italy! (These can keep the gelato cold for an hour outdoors!) 

Protip, get a Piccolo cone with strawberry and gianduia-- the combination is DELICIOUS. I would say its a little on the pricier side here, but totally worth it. (:
author: Maggie Y.

description:
I came here right after my trip to Italy because I missed eating gelato everyday and this place did not dissapoint. It's pretty much the closest thing I've had to gelato in Italy - the flavors are authentic and the texture is spot on. 

They have a rotating menu that they change every week and customers can even write down future flavor suggestions. Here are some of my favorites:

+ ALMOND & PISTACHIO: Their almond gelato is probably my favorite flavor ever and pairs really well with the pistachio one!
+ GIANDULA: Chocolate and hazelnut is the classic Italian gelato flavor. This combination reminds me of being back in Italy.

The prices are also not bad for SF:
$5 for a small (2 flavors)
$7 for a large (3 flavors)

Overall this is the best gelato place I've had outside of Italy so far so definitely give it a try!
author: Angela P.

description:
Not all ice cream is made equal. That can also be said for gelato. Yes! There is finally a store in the city which makes gelato how it's supposed to taste. It feeds my need for artisan-made desserts and Coletta fills that need so satisfyingly. 

Colette Gelato is located on Harrison Street in the SoMa area of San Francisco. It's on a pretty busy street, but we were able to find parking easily further down the street. I wouldn't say it's a busy area like the Mission district is. 

Customers can easily find the cute façade from the street with their pastel-colored wall and gelato cone statue outside their entrance. The space isn't that big on the interior, but there's a bench by the window (bench outside too.) and also 2 small tables. I can imagine that in the summer this place will probably have a line out the door. They serve a couple of different flavors on rotation each day and each flavor sounds delicious! 

The owners actually went to Gelato University and studied in Milan which tells you how authentic their gelato is. They have their gelato frozen at a higher temperature than regular ice creams. It comes out smooth and you don't even notice it's actually healthier than ice cream. I ordered a medium-sized cup of Coconut Cookie and Nocciola Regina. Nocciola is a hazelnut flavor and it was my favorite of the two. It is pricier than other places, but I would gladly pay for high-quality than mediocre any day.
author: Julie W.

description:
I have had such a bad past experience with gelato! 

Cue a knock at my office on my first day. Two men smiling and holding a bag with a mystery inside. We received three pints of gelato-Strawberry, Banana, and Gianduia (Chocolate with Hazelnut). 

The silver lining is that Gianduia gelato is now a newfound favorite of mine. It's the perfect combination of chocolate and hazelnut, but not too over or underwhelming. I love how it tastes like a ferrero rocher, but a colder and richer version.
author: Erica K.

description:
Lovely gelato shop in SOMA!! Coletta was super welcoming to my coworkers and I - we came in a huge group last Thursday. The staff patiently waited for us as we each tried different flavors before we individually settled down on our favorite flavor(s). 

I was in the mood for something fruity and refreshing. That day they only had one fruit-related flavor which was strawberry sorbetto. It had the perfect combination of both sweetness and tartness. I didn't want a huge waffle cone but I didn't wan't it in just a cup either. I settled for a small sized scoop in the small cone. Lots of options for picky people :) 

Would recommend & will come again!
author: Grace J.

description:
This is the best gelato I've had in the bay area hands down. So authentic and it totally transported me to some amazing gelato we had in Italy. The chocolate hazelnut flavor is a classic and a must try. The reason it surpasses other gelatos is the creaminess and richness, avoiding the watery/icy nature of some gelatos.
My husband tried coffee and pistachio which he enjoyed.
There isn't much room to sit though there are a few window seats.
author: Richa B.

description:
SO glad I found this place just in time for the warmer weather.

Walking in, the shop is small but well decorated. There are a few tables and a bench inside (as well as a bench outside) for you to enjoy your gelato.

Staff was incredibly friendly and was happy to provide samples. Turns out, he was one of the founders (Henri). Extremely nice guy!

I tried a few of their flavors--all were consistently delicious. Their gelato is rich in flavor and velvety in texture. 

I ended up going with the mint chip stracciatella & gianduia (chocolate and hazelnut). This is such a good combo!!! The mint was light and refreshing, while the gianduia provided a nice rich balance. If you decide to only get 1 flavor, I highly recommend the gianduia--basically a ferrero rocher in gelato form.

Small cup $5, medium $7. You can also purchase a pint if you'd like.

This place is so close to work that it's a bit dangerous, but I'll save Coletta Gelato as a way to reward myself after a long week :)
author: Shirley H.

description:
So we walked down to get something sweet after having lunch at HRD and found Coletta a couple blocks away.

It's a small little shop with gelato and sherbet. I really liked how they encourage us to sample all their flavors before you settle on one or two, mind you they don't have that many but still they are not stingy about it. We finally decided on Strawberry and Pistachio really good and refreshing.

Real nice and friendly staff, would definitely return to this spot when coming back to this area.
author: Graciela P.

description:
Fantastic Gelato spot

Great texture
Great flavor
Great portion
Great consistency 
Great customer service

Overall Thoughts

A+ Gelato destination!
author: Eddie W.

description:
Up until a few months ago, this area of SOMA was a ice cream desert. The closest options were either prepackaged ice cream from Walgreens/CVS or that way to rich stuff at Ghiradelli's at the Palace Hotel.

Then Small Foods opened at 2nd and Harrison and they serve Humphry Slocombe ice cream. I was pretty happy with that but when Coletta opened just down the street, I was overcome with excitement.

I shared the news with my coworkers and we were all curious to try to it out. But SF weather hasn't been the best recently and I don't like eating gelato/ice cream while wearing a winter coat.

With the glorious (but short) heat wave we are experiencing, I gathered up a small group and we took the 5 minute walk to Coletta. We arrived at the right time; within a few minutes, the line grew quite long. I sampled 3 flavors and ended up with half Nocciola Regina (Queen Hazelnut) and half Cookie Coconut. There are only 8 flavors at any given time; all are made with love and care. The small for $5 was plenty for me. The gelato flavors are creamy, milky, and delicious. There were a couple of sorbets for those who want something more refreshing.
author: Yi Z.

description:
I haven't been to this location but I had their gelato at a networking event and it blew me away! The consistency was perfect, it wasn't weighing me down, and every single flavor I tried was the best version of those flavors I've ever tried. Like, if you can make me like Mint Chocolate Chip, you're a magician. 
The guys serving the gelato also clearly loved the product and they were a pleasure to chat with. They answered my question and served no judgment. It was great!
I'm excited to stop by soon because I went home and dreamt of rich creamy frozen treats that fateful night.
author: Astrid V.
