description: The best black sesame gelato in the whole wide world.  I don't even need to try any other black sesame gelatos to make this statement because I am confident that this is #1.  The texture is so smooth, and the flavor is the strongest black sesame flavor I have ever had in anything.  As an Asian person who eats a lot of Asian food, this is a strong statement.  All their other flavors like the pistachio, mango, dairy free dark chocolate are all super amazing too, but that black sesame has rocked my world!
author: Wendy C.

description:
ZOMG!  Yeah, I said zomg.  

I think ice cream and gelato fall under the same category: heartbreak healer... or something a little more customer friendly, frozen yogurt.  I don't care for it nor do I need it since my friends say I'm heartless anyway.  That doesn't mean I won't indulge in a little bit of it, just enough to coat the tip of my tongue.  We sampled a few flavors such as the Cookie Coconut, Strawberry, Chocolate Hazelnut, and Cherry.  The texture was on point.  We didn't care for the Cherry as the flavor was very subtle which resulted in a plain vanilla base.  I went with the Cookie Coconut because it wasn't too sweet and I like cookies in my ice cream.  Our favorite would have to be the strawberry.  It reminds me of watermelon slush tapioca that I use to get back in the days; that hit of nostalgia does wonders.  

Super friendly service.  That strawberry tho...
author: Linda N.

description:
This is one of those places that change your perception of a neighborhood. We usually don't think there are very good places to enjoy like dessert or a snack in Soma but Collette is the one that changes it

I usually come for their fruit gelato or sorbet since they donit out of raw fruits and not pulp like most places in the city.

This time I had the fragolla and ganduia - strawberry and almond. Very very good. 

Highly recommended
author: Daniel C.

description: Oh yah, this place definitely deserves 5 stars. I don't think I have ever ate ice cream like this before. They have 3 different cup sizes which were all fairly small, definitely not the cold stone cup sizes. So I was expecting a small quantity, but man was I wrong! They kind of stack up the ice cream so you actually get a good amount even when the cup is fairly small. Now the ice cream, I got the hazelnut and hazelnut chocolate, both like nutella and yet theres a difference. The ice cream was so smooth and soft it almost feels like as if its not ice cream, except it is. we also got the mango and strawberry sorbet. both tasted as if there were made from real ripe fruit. I would definitely go back again for after dinner dessert and I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for good quality and quantity ice cream.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Friendly service and delicious gelato and sorbet - Coletta is great! 

The shop replaces the former Crepe-Madame, and previously Ciao Bella Gelato. It has several tables, with a large window on Harrison, nicely designed signs and jars of ingredients on shelves. One could suggest new flavors by writing them on a list on the wall. They are making their own Fior di Latte as a gelato base. Mint chip stracciatella is very good.

What's interesting is that the sorbets taste like gelato due to their creaminess. Highlights are melon and mango. 

I look forward to trying new flavors. They offer catering, which would be a great idea for your next event. Visit when you're in the area!
author: Carol W.

description:
Incredibly friendly staff willing to give you a sample of the daily flavors. The plain chocolate is definitely delicious, as is their version of mint chip (large shavings of chocolate, crispy in the cold). They have un-ordinary flavors too, such as chai, which definitely packs a spicy kick. A refreshing treat on a warm day, particularly as the weather begins to warm up. 

Cute little shop with a few seats inside and a bench outside. Not hard to spot from the street with the signage and large ice cream cone perched on the sidewalk. Good location in SoMa.

Nothing too spectacular though.
author: Alison A.

description:
Wowowow. This review is for the service and the quality of the product I purchased at Coletta. My friend and I visited one weekday afternoon to try the gelato here. Fellow Yelper Madeleine M. had recommended this place as she knew I was staying in FiDi. Was this code for "Bring me back a pint when I see you next?" Even if it wasn't, we did: Two pints, grapefruit and Gianduia. 

I have to credit Noah for his superfantabulous service during our visit. We were curious and he answered all of our questions and allowed us to sample the flavors. We elected to try grapefruit and tiramisu, and purchased two pints of Gianduia and one pint of Grapefruit to-go.  I want to especially recognize Noah for his willingness to hand-pack a pint of grapefruit for us on the spot. On a recent visit to Bi-Rite Creamery in the Mission, I was mortified to see one of the workers berate my companion for asking for a quart of earl grey ice cream. After that experience, I was prepared for Noah to say no, but he happily obliged and even asked if we wanted a ribbon and heart-shaped sticker! 

Kudos to Noah for making this high-quality product the treat it is, from hello to nom! I finished a pint in a day. It truly is as displayed in the glass mason jar-layers of dark chocolate and gelato. The consistency is consistent throughout the pint, as Noah described. 

Overall, 5 stars and can't wait to return!
author: Jen B.

description:
Tried out Coletta Gelato it's on Harrison St & 3rd.  Down 3rd from SFMOMA so stop over here afterwards!

Noah was working and gave me all the samples I wanted.  I think I tried them all and every single one was good.

Flavors they have:
Almost Chai
Calif Pistachio
Fior di Latte
Gianduia
Grapefruit sorbet
Melon sorbet
Irish coffee
Nocciola

I got a small cup $5 for 2 flavors: Nocciola & Fior di Latte because of the owners likes them and I enjoyed my gelato!  Medium is $7; Large is $9.  Charge it if you want.

Can't wait to go back and try more flavors.  I hope they open on Sundays in the future.

New hrs: Tues-Sat 12-9
author: Ann L.

description:
Simply the best gelato. They rotate their flavors every week, and every flavor I've had is spot on. 

No crazy toppings or gimmicks, just pure delicious.

The most impressive were the pistachio and watermelon which taste exactly like the food (in ice cream form), and not like an imitation flavor version.

Their hazelnut/chocolate flavor and almost chai flavors are also excellent and worth a trip over.
author: Elena K.

description: Really good. The gelato is super creamy and I really enjoyed all the flavors they had. We got Salted Butter Caramel and Pistachio and liked how creamy both were. Customer service was also great!
author: Clara L.

description:
This place makes my favorite gelato ever. I have tried lot of gelato, but this spot has the fluffiest stuff. I first tried them at a Yelp Elite event where I was super impressed. Since the event I have been to their physical location a couple of times. Still super impressed every time I go. 

It a small spot, located in the a furniture store. Kind of easy to miss. 

Definitely worth multiple visits.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Checkout this place before it gets too popular! Went on a weekend and there was no line. We had 8 flavors to choose from and they were very generous with the samples. We settled on a medium scoop with three flavors, melon, Irish coffee, and mint chip stracciatella. 

Loved all these flavors especially the Irish coffee because coffee is my favorite ice cream flavor. Melon tasted very natural. Mint chip had small pieces of chocolate. It was all relatively creamy and every flavor was delicious. 

Definitely checking this place out again!
author: Edward W.

description: This place is pretty close to Cal Train so I sometimes come here after work. And guess what flavor I always opt for? PISTACHIO. But all of their flavors are good. Don't be afraid to sample! The prices are on the higher side here, but hey, the quality of the gelato is amazing. The pistachio flavor is perfectly nutty and not overly sweet. Super rich and creamy without being heavy. It's quite impressive. Highly recommend!!
author: Ashley Y.

description: A hole in the wall ice cream place with great varieties.
author: Shilpa G.

description:
I just came back from Italy and needed an authentic gelato fix. Melanie N and I were in the area and saw signage for Coletta and immediately walked there. The shop is opened by two friends (Henri and Antonio) who went to Gelato University in Italy (I want to study there!) so they learned from the masters and it reflects on their beautifully made gelato.

The shop is cute and clean and has clear jars of waffle cones and biscotti (or cantucinni as they called it in Italy) and an adorable wallpaper picture of a who I assume is Nicoletta, Henri's grandmother. 

I sampled their peanut butter and dark chocolate but ultimately settled on Gianduja (hazelnut and chocolate) which tasted similar to Nutella. Perfectly made gelato that is smooth, soft, dense, and sweet. I'm a total fan! 

I'll be sure to come back again and try their other flavors. It's a nice après meal dessert.
author: Nette T.

description: Probably the best gelato I've ever had. I stopped by once while on a date and have gone back numerous times. The owner is super nice, the scoops are suuupeerrr generous, and the flavors change quite often! I feel you really can't go wrong with any of their flavors. They have options that are available for any kind of dietary restriction without compromising taste. I absolutely love Coletta Gelato and everyone I've taken there adores it. If I could give it a 10, I'd give it an 11.
author: Francis V.

description:
I'm so happy they opened a gelato shop in the SoMa neighborhood! On my way home, I like to sneak in and indulge in a nice, sweet treat!

I love their hazelnut ones and they have the right amount of decadence and creaminess. You can even eat part of it, freeze it, and eat it later and still tastes great to me. Although forewarning, that is pretty hard to control yourself and not eat the whole thing!
author: Janet H.

description:
I'm in LOVE with this gelato place. The employee(pretty sure he's the owner)  was very kind and helpful. He was very knowledgeable of all the flavors and the shop. Really easy to talk to and answered all of our questions.

The shop is small but very lively. Beautiful mural, a lot of appropriate and fun accent pieces. 

Gelato is made daily and flavors change weekly! 

A lot of community is in one shop. Customers can help vote for upcoming seasonal flavors and businesses can put in their business cards for a raffle. 

They also have cards if you buy 9, you get one free! 

The gelato for the quality is very inexpensive!! And worth the price tbh, the gelato was creamy and tasted fresh. I wish they had one in sj):
author: Jennifer C.

description:
It's summer time...which is basically synonymous with ICE CREAM TIME. This gelato is seriously creamy. Two bites were satisfingly enough for me.

Strawberry: refreshing, almost tasted like it had a hint of mint in it. A great summer flavor for sure.

Gianduia: Tastes like you think it would...a cold ferrero rocher. I guess I'm not a nutella fan like everyone else, so take this flavor review with a pinch of salt (mmm, dark chocolate sea salt).

A 3.75 for me-- it was good, but it wasn't omg amaze or anything.
--

Oh Coletta, you never fail to impress. It's winter time now, but I checked out your almond, grapefruit, meyer lemon, and mango sorbetto recently. First let's talk about that texture. How do you do it? It's basically melted, but still intact. The texutre is light and doesn't make you feel gross after. The almond is light and creamy. The mango sorbetto was like eating a perfectly ripe Alphonso mango. The lemon had the perfect amount of zest. The grapefruit captured all the nice things about grapefruit. I'll be back! 4/5.

--
And Coletta does it again! I came back for the black sesame and caramel. A tad sweet for my tastes, but the sesame is rich and nutty, while the caramel is sweet and soft. They play well with each other. I'm a fan. Erm, I think it'd be bad to say I came back yet again, but I got the pistachio and cinammon. The pistachio was nutty and smooth. Not really my thing, but I'm not a big pistachio person. The cinammon reminded me a sugary cinnamon toast crunch-- less focus on the aroma. I preferred the lemon and mango! Tumeric had a slight herby taste to it and wasn't too sweet. Unique, but not quite my thing. Anddd back at it. Saffron was almost a bit...(to my untrained saffron tastes), plasticky but pleasant, would be the best way to describe it. As in, I liked it, but it reminded me of that in an odd way. My Persian friend who tried it said there was too much saffron, which can't be bad, right? 4/5. Bicycle coffee was alright, but it never is coffee enough for me-- I had this flavor at Little Giant and felt the same way, so maybe it's a bicycle coffee thing...3.25/5.
author: Nicole H.

description: OMG!  Amazing. My husband who doesn't typically like switching up his ice cream was in love!
author: Rachel H.

description:
Some friends recommended this spot, claiming it's the best in the city. And I like to think of myself as an ice cream connoisseur so I had to try it. However, this is a gelato spot! 

We ordered the piccolo size (basically a medium), it was $5, and we get two generous scoops, so I picked the guava flavor and cookie coconut flavor. These paired well together. 

As for the sizing, they have bambino (small), piccolo (medium) & grande (large). Also, they have flavors of the day, so look out for the variety. 

During my second visit, I noticed you can buy cartons if their gelato, can order take outs and that they cater. On the second visit, we ordered the nectarine and hazelnut, also pretty good, but preferred the guava/cookie coconut.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Coletta Gelato is sensational! 

I have tried numerous flavors and I have never once walked away disappointed. 

From pistachio to cookies and cream to mango to watermelon, they have a flavor no matter what you're in the mood for. 

What's most outstanding is the fruit flavors that actually taste like the fruit they're made from instead of the artificial flavors that taste nothing like the real fruit. 

The watermelon tasted just like a real, delicious watermelon. The mango tasted like dried mango strips. 
The strawberry tasted more like artificial strawberries than real ones but was delicious nonetheless. 

They also change their available flavors every Tuesday so this place will never get old. 

Coletta Gelato is doing a lot of things right in the way of their gelato. I'm surprised there isn't constantly a line outside.
author: Nick D.

description:
You say "Gelato"... and I say "Coletta."

My office mates and I were recently treated to an afternoon scoop here. It was the perfect reprieve from the brutal Bay Area heatwave (can anyone remember the last time it was THIS hot in June?!). This SOMA gelato shop is definitely a hole-in-the-wall establishment. Blink and you might miss it. But once you find it, you'll be rewarded with a wide array of fun flavors (which rotate regularly). While my co-workers tried Hazelnut/Chocolate, Mint Chip, and Mango Sorbet... I took a more conventional approach and ordered a scoop of Strawberry. Call me boring, but it totally hit the spot! I felt like a 10 year-old kid again as I licked at my cone.

If you work in the area, I highly recommend visiting Coletta if/when you need some sweet relief.
author: Kevin B.

description: 100 Gelato! I come here every weekend The black chocolate one tastes great! Perfect spot for desert in SOMA!
author: Peizhi Z.

description: This is my favorite gelato place! My boyfriend and I have been going ever since it has opened. This gelato brings me back to being in Italy, eating it every day. It is super authentic and I love the creaminess! They have the best pistachio gelato! I pretty much get that every time I go. They have rotating flavors, but it's hard to beat the pistachio. If you love gelato, you should definitely go!
author: Kim C.

description: This cute little shop is in an unlikely spot in SOMA. They have a list by the entrance filled with provocative flavor suggestions made by customers like Celery and Szechuan Peppercorn. Tally marks showed that a chili flavor was currently the fan favorite. The actual flavor selection was thankfully limited. I get slight anxiety when inundated with flavor options. I have to first choose flavors to sample and then out of those that I do or don't even sample I have to choose what to eventually get. Keeping options simple makes things easier and I would venture to say is a sign of the fine quality of what is available. I grabbed a rewards card while waiting in line before trying anything. Then I had samples of the Salted Butter Caramel, Pistachio, and Gianduia. Each flavor was so tantalizing and seductive. I decided on a small cup of the Pistachio and got a mini cone of the Meyer Lemon from the Yelp checkin. The gelato smooth in texture and rich in taste. I know I will come back again.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Coletta is, without a doubt, the best ice cream/gelato option near my SoMa office. Their flavors rotate regularly so there's always something new to taste and the friendly staff are always game to let you try before you buy (sample away, y'all). 

On my first visit I wrote on their flavor suggestion board that I'd like to see a passionfruit coconut offering. When I stopped in after lunch this week they had passionfruit sorbetto and both cookie coconut and pina colada in rotation. (Prayers answered!)

Now I hope Coletta will consider granting my next level frozen wish: yogurt gelato and grapefruit sorbetto. Whilst traveling in Italy this was my go to combo and I've never been able to indulge in its deliciousness in America. 

Bottom line: If you like gelato, you'll love Coletta.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Creamy. Flavorful. Delicious. Had your gelato on my mind while I was running errands this very warm afternoon in SF. Stopped in on my way home and was helped by a wonderful staff member. Tried three different flavors and settled on your dark chocolate mousse and your mint stracciatella - soooooooo gooooood! 

My only mistake was eating them in a cup and not one of your delicious sugar cones. 

I'll . . . be . . . back. Thanks for bringing me back to the warm summer days of being a kid with a tasty ice cream in her hand.
author: Gayle A.

description: This place moved out of the mission to soma and is pretty amazing. Better than bi rite and you probably won't wait an hour in line like a Sf techie hipster. The flavors they have are locally sourced and I got pistachio and dark chocolate. The staff are nice.
author: Olivia G.

description: This super duper cute gelato shop has been open since January around the corner form my place and I was not aware of it and maybe that was a good thing because I am in gelato trouble now. The place is small and just adorable, the staff is friendly and it is a pleasure to order from. Tried almost all the flavors and ended up getting large $7 with three flavors gelato - coconut, pistachio and chocolate hazelnut (Giandiuia ) which is my favorite hands down. From the soft sweet milky texture and yummy flavors to beautiful colors this charming gelato place put a big kid smile on my sticky face. Yay !
author: Magda G.

description: Go. Run. There's nothing else to say. This is the best gelato place in SF hands down. Even rivals the Italian gelato we had in Rome! Made fresh every morning, with a new special flavor every weekend- the flavors burst in your mouth and make other places look like child's play
author: Sarah L.

description:
They let you sample their flavors, so I tried their chocolate, hazelnut + chocolate (forgot the name but tastes like nutella) , and pistachio flavors. I thought the chocolate one was too rich so we got the nutella and pistachio flavors as scoops.

The nutella one is amazing (the chocolate balances out the hazelnut very well and there are hazelnut pieces, yum) and the pistachio one was a bit too nutty but still good.

The different flavors are definitely true to the name.
author: Shibo F.

description: Not proper gelato. Texture wasn't natural & had a greasy moth feel. Flavor was lacking & the choc mint was synthetically coloured. Authentic gelato doesn't employ synthetic colouring agents & hence would never appear fluro green. I threw it in the bin as it was truly the worst "gelato" I've tried in a long time. I understand this isn't the gelato capital of the world but I felt this was a poor attempt & it is unsatisfactory to refer to this product as gelato in the first place.
author: Jan P.

description: I was first introduced to this gelato shop at my boyfriend's company holiday party where Coletta had a gelato cart there. The cart was adorable and the gelato was delicious. It was a hit at the party! Words cannot describe how delicious this gelato is. The consistency is creamy and smooth while still feeling light in my stomach. My next encounter with Coletta was on a way to a wedding where we quickly pulled over and NEEDED a scoop of ice cream before the wedding. The pistachio is to die for. The customer service is just as great. We have yet to have a negative experience at Coletta. In fact, we picked up three containers of pistachio gelato today! I can't wait to dive in!
author: Jessica Y.

description: My boyfriend and I have passed this place numerous times and finally decided to stop in.  It's a small shop but very cute in the inside.  The guy behind the counter was super friendly and allowed us to try all the flavors that our heart desired.  We decided on Gianduji (like Nutella), guava and coconut rum. Highly recommend the gianduji, you can taste the quality of the ingredients.  Only high quality chocolate and hazelnuts were used in this gelato.  My boyfriend is not even a huge fan of nutella and loved it!  The guava was very refreshing, tasted like a tropical get away and combined with the coconut rum, I thought I was on a beach sipping a delicious cocktail.  The flavors rotate each week and they have creative ones like coffee caradom and honey lavender.  But would definitely be back for more gelato here!
author: Lauren S.

description:
YES. YES. YES. 

Colette Gelato has a special place in my heart forever. Their gelato is so fresh, delicious and different. I stumbled across this place on Google shortly after moving to the area and once I went to check it out, I was blown away. The first flavor I've had there was AVOCADO... which I called about 14 people to rave about it. They mostly thought it was a weird flavor of ice cream. But I thought it was perfect. The gelato is so smooth and creamy. The second flavor I had was Coffee Crunch. Which was good, but not nearly as good as the Avocado. Last week I went back for the Avocado, but the lovely young lady working there, broke the news to me that they rotate flavors. I was heart broken but also excited to try a new flavor. I went with Coconut. I don't even like Coconut anything, but it was GREAT. I also had the Guava. Which was AMAZING!!! I brought my dog with me and they were fine with having him in the store. 
NOTE: This place is small but beautiful. They also don't have toppings but may have some in the future. LOVE LOVE LOVE.
author: Tati C.

description: Tasting the gelatos here brings me back to the time I was in Italy back in 2010. Definitely will come back for more :)
author: Hakim R.

description:
Never have I felt somewhere more deserving of a five-star review.

Coletta gelato is hands down incredible. It certainly rivals any italian gelateria in quality and exceeds in creativity. I have tried the black sesame, mint chip, chocolate hazelnut, pistachio, chocolate sorbetto and salted caramel. Each and every one is creamy, flavorful, rich and intensely delicious. The owners are very friendly and the location is small but adorable. 

While I would eat any and every one of their flavors on a daily basis, the true winner for me is the chocolate sorbetto. It is somehow dairy free and vegan which is almost unbelievable given how rich and delicious it is--an essential for any dark chocolate lover! 

This place is a great addition to Soma and I will definitely be back again and again!
author: Julia H.

description:
I have been eyeing this place for some time now and finally got to try it out yesterday.  I am quite picky when it comes to sweets because my philosophy is that sweets has to be extraordinary to be worth the calories.
The gelato here is beyond worth it!!!
Colette Gelato is amazing! It is dense, not overly sweet and the balance of the texture is divine.  Loved that they have non-dairy option too.
author: S H.

description:
Happiness by the scope, their ice creams and sorbets are simply amazing.
Gianduia or Nuntella© is my favorite and goes amazingly well with pistachios.
I can't remember having better ice cream than this, I highly recommend this place.
Oh and they sell boxes so you can repeat the experience at home every day of the week. Makes for fantastic present.
author: Jr P.

description:
I discovered Coletta Gelato through a Yelp event and immediately knew I had to check out their store front.  The gelato is creamy and the flavors are pure - the pistachio is reminiscent of gelato in Italy, the strawberry and guava sorbettos are creamy and loaded with fresh fruit flavor.  And surprisingly, the coconut cookie was the best coconut flavored frozen dessert I've ever had! 
The coconut was not heavy or overwhelming, it was refreshing and perfectly complemented with bits of crumbly shortbread cookie.  Moreover the waffle cone was excellent.

The only reason I can't give Coletta 5 stars is because of the price and inconsistency in portion size.  Scoops were $5 for a piccolo (2 flavors) and $7 for a grande (3 flavors), which is quite pricey ($4.50 or $4.75 would have seemed more reasonable in my book).  But the bigger issue was that the customer in front of us ordered a piccolo and got two hefty scoops from one server, then my boyfriend ordered a piccolo from the other server and received significantly less gelato.  The other customer received about 150% more gelato than he did, which left him very grumpy just based on principle.  I, on the other hand, ordered a piccolo in a cone instead of cup, and was served a more generous serving of gelato.

All in all, Coletta is a must-go if you want delicious gelato.  Just be sure to order the grande if you want to be guaranteed a good serving size.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
*** In Short ***

Really, really, REALLY creamy gelato.

*** In Depth ***

Now, depending on how you like your gelato, this can be a boon or a curse, but regardless of which camp you fall into, Coletta certainly has a different take on gelato, serving up the richest and creamiest gelato I've ever had. Now, that's not to say the flavors themselves are overpowering: no, those are done just right. We're talking about the texture of the gelato itself here, which can feel heavy enough that some folks may have trouble getting more than halfway through a small. But, if you're a fan of smooth, rich, creamy gelatos, Coletta is definitely right up your alley.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - On the smaller side and with limited seating, but expect your usual ice cream display case heights and the reaching for samples that comes with it.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description:
After seeing their sign on the corner of Harrison/3rd everyday after work, I finally stopped by to give Coletta a try. I'm glad I did!

Very friendly service that very energetically describes the gelato (and history of) and offer free samples of everything to try.

^ While this is obviously a wonderful thing, I should pass along that, if my experience was common, you will be waiting for quite a bit as every person in front of you samples nearly every flavor and talks at length about each :)

I had a light, lemon-tinged vanilla which has a name I can't recall. A generous scoop in a small bowl cost $5. 

I would go back for sure.
author: Josh M.

description:
Best spot in this area .
Great flavors . 
Pistachio

Definitely recommend to anyone in SF .
author: Karan C.

description:
AMAZINGGG 

Its tucked away in an area that's not super busy. The space isn't big and the flavors aren't special but the ice cream flavors are so authentic and aromatic. Definitely quality over quantity here. I always have a difficult time deciding between nutty flavors and fruity ones but you get to have 2 flavors in 1 cup so that's pretty much perfection. 

There is not much seating and not many places nearby to just sit and finish your ice cream so you might have to just stand around or walk & eat.
author: Shelly L.

description: The best gelato in the city and I mean it! I've tried gelato in many other places including in the North Beach, no one even close.
author: Anton P.

description:
I cannot emphasize ENOUGH how amazing Noah and Coletta are. We catered Coletta at our wedding this past Saturday and since the moment we emailed Noah for a quote all the way to the end of our wedding reception, Noah has been nothing been accommodating, professional, kind, and awesome! This is what customer service is. I think it has already been established hands down how amazing Coletta's gelato is - but having them at our wedding only revealed how 10/10 their customer service is as well. 

They offer different packages when you request for their catering services. At first we decided to go with 4 flavors and half-scoops for each guest due to our limited dessert budget. But because my husband's sister loves Coletta - she offered to sponsor a larger 8 flavor package - and that is where we were all the more amazed how the Coletta team is. We wanted a flavor with pineapple in it because my sister-in-law loves pineapples - and requested if they can create an entirely new flavor Dole Whip. Noah responded a couple days later and said they had looked into recipes and would introduce it at our wedding! WOWZERS! What I further love about them is that they had decided not to bring Dole Whip because the pineapples they received weren't ripe - talk about quality control. Instead they brought my second choice Banana Speculoos which I ended up LOVING!

Coletta is AMAZING. All our guests both who know of and love Coletta as well as those who had their gelato for the first time all LOVED them! We wouldn't have wanted our wedding any other way - Coletta made it extra extra extra special! Thank you Noah and Antonio and the Coletta team for your amazing service! We can't wait for our wedding pictures to come out for some official pictures with the gelato carts, Noah, and Antonio! 

We would recommend catering Coletta for ANY event! They are professional, flexible, understanding, accommodating, and caring throughout the whole process!
author: Heidi T.

description:
Product quality is amazing. Traditional Italian recipes with fresh Californian ingredients made on Italian machinery. Some of the very best gelato I've ever had. 
Love also the garage vibe and setting of this place -- SOMA meets Roma. 
I'm totally hooked. Go here.
author: Jason R.

description:
I've worked in SoMa for the last 4 years and my co-workers and I disliked how there weren't any good dessert places close to our office... until Coletta opened. Now it's one of our go-to spots!

They switch up their flavors every day, and they allow you to try samples, which is always a plus. In the times that I've visited they've also had sorbets in case you were in the mood for something fruitier. You can't go wrong with either one.

It's also a must to try their gelato with their cones. They aren't ever stale or artificial, and are packed with freshness and flavor. They also give generous scoops of gelato regardless if you get a cone or a cup, so you definitely get what you pay for which is *rare* when it comes to trendy SF food spots.

I've tried several gelato spots before, and this one is definitely ranked in my top 3!
author: Josephine L.

description: Very good quality gelato, the place is quite small, but the servers are very kind and it was enjoyable.
author: Anmol J.

description:
I was so impressed with this cute gelato place! The service was friendly and the quality of the gelato was amazing. There's a few tables inside to sit at.

We got a medium for $7 which is pricey but it's a large enough serving size that you can share with two people. You can get a mix of flavors in your cup. I got the pistachio and spiced cookie flavors. They were light and not too heavy which I really liked. The texture is very dense and creamy. My fiance go the hazelnut and dark chocolate flavors which were so good and rich. The dark chocolate flavor is extremely intense. I never had gelato like it before.

Overall it's a great place to hang out and enjoy some high quality gelato. I can't wait to try their other flavors.
author: Linda X.

description: I absolutely love icecreams, gelatos, sherbets and sorbets; and get random cravings on a regular basis. I was paying the bay bridge toll and all of a sudden it hit me "you deserve some icecream, but not just any icecream". So of course I open yelp (because I'm not from the area, just happen to be driving through). GELATO plus 5 stars jumped out at me, then I saw unique flavors and I was sold. Now I have a new "must have" next time I'm in Frisco, a scoop of pistachio and almond from Coletta Gelato!!
author: Zenia C.

description: Such a cute and delicious gelato place! I tried almost every flavor (they had about 8) and all were great. I ended up getting strawberry and almond, which went so well together. The strawberry was light and tasted like fresh strawberries, and the almond was mild and super creamy. The cones are delicious too! I will definitely return.
author: L R.

description: Love this little hidden gem! This gelato is the real deal... try the pistachio you won't regret it!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Excited that this little gem opened up in SOMA, but there's not a lot of foot traffic in this area, so hopefully it's getting enough business. The flavors change up all the time which is great for commitment-phobes, but it sucks when you find a flavor you love and it's gone the next day or week (melon gelato come back!!!)

The main win here - the texture. There's no icy bits to dilute the flavor or change the consistency. I'm usually not a fan of sorbet because of the ice, but this gelato is creamy and smooth without being so milky that it resembles ice cream. I have yet to be bold and daring and try out all the flavors, but notably, here are my thoughts on the following:

Pistachio 4/5: super super pistachio-y, more so than the average pistachio flavored frozen treat. I'm not as into it, but if intense flavor is what you love, then go for this.

Hazelnut 4/5: It's like eating a cold creamy ferrero rocher, a good balance of chocolate-y taste without being too rich.

Melon 5/5: Really velvety texture, likely because it's fruity and not creamy, but not a chunky or seed filled fruit. Definitely my favorite here. 

Strawberry 5/5: potent fruit flavors are my jam which is why I loved this rich almost-strawberry-shortcake-esque flavor. Super refreshing and light, almost like drinking a smoothie but in gelato form.
author: Kathy T.

description: Cute place and really friendly service. Flavors are not out-there crazy-type selections, but solid options, such as pistachio, almond, strawberry, white peach, chocolate-peanut butter, etc. They allow you taste before deciding. Also looks like you can have two flavors even for the piccolo size which I wish I had known.
author: Stephanie L.

description: The staff here was great and were patient with us while we sampled the various flavors.  I am a big fan of pistachio-flavored frozen treats and received a healthy portion of it in my cup.  You won't find any crazy flavors here but they do the classic flavors justice.  The shop is small, but there are a few seats available inside and a bench outside.  Coming here on a hot day (in SF standards) was the perfect post-lunch treat.
author: Justin L.

description: For our wedding last summer, I thought it would be fun to surprise my guests with gelato towards the end of the night. I came across Coletta and they seemed like the perfect fit. They were super easy and friendly to communicate with as a vendor. I didn't really get to enjoy the gelato myself because I was so busy on my wedding day, but our non-dancing guests loved the surprise. I hope to visit their location in the city someday!
author: Kate M.

description: Small place with awesome gelato and awesome staff. I pass by this place often, so this past Saturday my bf and I finally made our way inside. The servers were really nice and can give suggestions based on what you're craving - chocolate, fruity, creamy, whatever you want :) This time, I went with a fruity sorbet/sorbetto since it was really hot out - I think it was the mango one. However, I also had a taste of the Gianduia which tastes like Nutella in ice cream form. My bf wanted to come back on Sunday but unfortunately they're closed all day on Sunday :( Great find in SOMA. And it's a short walk from South Beach if you want a cool treat and a nice, newly-renovated park to hang out in. I'm sure I'll be returning to Coletta Gelato soon since I'm eager to try more of their flavours!
author: Bianca C.

description:
Okay so I actually haven't been here but as I was stopped at the intersection, I looked in and I saw the girl behind the counter, who was armed with an electric fly swatter, engage in a grueling death-match with a fly who found its way in to the store. 

I expect anyone this dedicated to the cleanliness of their store to provide me with A-1 service. Five stars.
author: Jackie C.

description: Lots of vegan and dairy free options. Got strawberry sorbet and vegan dark chocolate mousse. It was wonderful and the strawberry sorbet had actual strawberry seeds in it.
author: Autumn B.

description:
My first ever gelato experience was with Coletta and since then I am have become a fan of them both. My favorite is the infamous Gianduia aka Choclate Hazelnut Nutella flavored gelato where you can taste the crunchy chips amidst the dense choclate richness of the gelato. It pretty much looks like eating a cold, creamy freshly prepared scoop of forerro rocher in a cup/cone. I have also tried their seasonal raspberry sorbet and it was fresh as the fruit itself. 
The best part is it is decently priced and comes in all sizes. I usually get their big boxes packed for late night cravings. 
A must visit.
author: Shatakshi G.

description:
Happy this place opened, as I was just bemoaning the lack of a good ice cream shop in the area. Cute (but small) shop that has hipster vibes. They seem to focus on really fresh and good ingredients here and a constant rotation of flavors. 

So far I've tried the mint stracciatella (cool and refreshing), strawberry (amazing, and tastes like freshly crushed strawberries), coconut cookie (so good! I love coconut and I love cookies so a perfect combo for me), and the milk tea (good as well, but stood out less). You can get two different flavors in a small, which is just the perfect amount for me. 

They take suggestions for new flavors as well, so write your suggestion down before you go! =)
author: Vivian L.

description:
A cute little gelato shop in SOMA.  Flavors were pretty standard, two hazelnut gelatos (one with milk chocolate) that were yummy!  I'd say it's all around pretty solid, but not my favorite just because I didn't find anything truly unique and some of their flavors (pistachio, cookie coconut) ran a little too sweet for my taste.  The texture was on point though!  Drippy upon handover, causing me to awkwardly lick things in the face of strangers (just like in Italy!).

Tips and Tricks
-Plenty of street parking in the surrounding area
-Dark chocolate and strawberry sorbets are good for those who don't dig too much sweet
-$5 for a piccolo, 2 flavors in a cup but only 1 in a cone
-Always ask for samples!
author: Jessica L.

description:
I'm not a big gelato fan but this place has the smoothest and most velvety gelato I've had in my life. Coletta is in a small and quaint shop and has that SF-aesthetic that is oh-so-alluring to aspiring social media butterflies. 

I tried the Gianduia and Almond flavors and it was just primo. The Gianduia was essentially chocolate hazelnut but it had chunks of some chocolate or wafer in in that was just awesome. Overall selection of flavors is very nice and I'm definitely putting this place in the back of my mind for the next time I'm in the area. 

Price at the time was $5 for the small (1-2 flavors).
author: Daniel C.

description: Best ice cream I've had in the city yet! Every single flavor is made with fresh and natural ingredients. I got the guava and pear sorbets. The pear especially stood out. I came pretty near closing time so there was no line. Looking forward to my next visit already!
author: Sophia H.

description: Amazing gelato! I had 1 scoop of amaretto and 1 scoop of nocciola (hazelnut), and both were amazing. This place is really tiny, so it's best to eat to-go, but there are a few stools facing the street. It was a little pricey, but nothing too crazy for gelato in the city.
author: Brittany B.

description:
Coletta Gelato gives new meaning to CREAMY.

Portions are generous considering how rich the gelato is. In hindsight a small (piccolo) - 2 flavors max - is more than enough. I wanted the waffle cone which comes with 3 flavors max (grande size).  The texture is BEYOND. Smooth and velvety. 

Since there was no line I practically sampled their entire selection guilt-free. Gianduja (chocolate hazelnut), Peanut Butter, Amaretto, Almond, and Pistachio were winners!
author: Chris S.

description: Amazing gelato! Got the medium size with one scoop of Gianduia (basically it's Nutella) and one scoop of Mediterranee (pistachio/almond). It was delicious, really big and tasty.
author: Coralie S.

description:
I just happened to be walking by when I came across the Coletta Gelato sign. Why yes I'd love some gelato - what a pleasant surprise and lovely addition to the neighborhood. Gelato is a gift from the gods south of market. I'm extra glad it's not another coffee shop! 
It turned out to be the shop's first day. It's super cute interior, jars of delicious candies, chocolates, and cookies lined up on the shelf, a lovely wooden speaker, sparkly clean glass displaying gelato. Nothing too crazy just gelato in a small, medium, and large size. I tried a few things like the amaretto which was so zesty and fresh. The gianduja caught my eye because of it's interesting name (it's a chocolate hazelnut) but my heart belongs to everything that is coconut, banana, and rum. Yum. It had me at coconut... So I went for that and also tried the grapefruit. I was told it was freshly squeezed that morning and I was sold! I opted for the medium size ($7) and got coconut banana rum , and grapefruit. Such a delicious treat! I'll def be back to try all the new flavors. They said flavors were very seasonal and based on what was fresh that day. Exciting!
author: Veronica L.

description:
This place is excellent. I got the Piccolo cone with 2 scoops (ritual coffee with cardamom and black sesame). More than enough for two people sharing the cone!

P.S. The biscotti and cookies on the left side of the wall are for decoration only! I almost bought one until the cashier told me. :)
author: Thomas L.

description: Wow! I usually prefer ice cream over gelato but this place really takes the cake! The shop is very cute and minimal. I tried saffron, chamomile, pistachio, and their chocolate hazelnut--all delicious. The pistachio was exceptional though--perfect texture and flavor. Truly, a mouth full of bliss. Another great thing about this is that it is only 12 minutes from the Cal Train!
author: Vina V.

description:
Creamiest gelato ever! The place is small and cute, with 2 tables and a long bench for seating. Super friendly staff/owners who insist on you sampling the flavors! 

Get the Gianduia, especially if you are a chocolate lover. It's chocolate hazelnut with crispy chocolate (wafer?) pieces. So good!! 

Also delicious were coco banana rum (not an overpowering banana flavor) and pistachio. Excited to come back to try more flavors and maybe take home one of the to-go pints!
author: Pallavi K.

description:
A work colleague went out for dessert with his team one day and recommended this place to me. I decided to do the same with my own team! 

This place is about a 5-10 minute walk from our building, we walked over on a Friday afternoon at about 2:30pm. We came with quite a few people so I think this cleared out some of the people sitting down, whoops. Venue is cute and clean, very hipster yet simple. One man working behind the counter and I thought "aw, this guy runs this place by himself" but my raucous group brought out a few workers from the back to say hello and thank you.

They give you a TON of gelato for the price. Ordered a small for 5 bucks with a cone and I could not even finish it. I ordered the chocolate/hazelnut one (Guanduja) and it tasted like it had bits of Ferrero Rocher in it! Awesome gelato spot and the rest of my team agrees! Will def be back more in the summertime (-:
author: Genevieve M.

description: Pretty great tasting gelato! Definitely up there in quality, and the price is pretty good at 5$ for the small (two flavors). I didn't really like most of their flavors though, which is pretty unfortunate. I thought it was served at too high a temperature; it was pretty melty and soft immediately. Do NOT get the cone. Not only did the ice cream drip through the bottom tip, it also leaked straight through the sides of the cone! Obviously this lead to very messy results.
author: Helena Q.

description:
It's just the best gelato. Period. Great texture and flavors, served up generously.

(And it helps that everyone who works here is beautiful.)
author: Bîron S.

description: I've been wanting to try this place since everyone raves about it.  Overall I liked it but I didn't feel like it was worth going out of your way for.  I like how the default cone is a waffle cone, versus charging you more for the waffle cone.  The texture is very smooth and fine, however the ice cream flavors (for reference we got the Gianduia and almond) could be a bit stronger. Garden Creamery is way better.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Ordered the chocolate hazelnut and Italian chocolate chip on a cone. Quick and friendly service, and the gelato was really good! Will definitely stop by next time I'm in the city.
author: Jeron W.

description: Life-changing gelato. Period. Got the chocolate hazelnut and verve caffe. Generous servings and way cheaper than Salt & Straw. The texture is very smooth and rich. Love this place!
author: Nancy L.

description:
I told myself I was too full to eat any desserts when I walked in... and then I tried the Strawberry and I just HAD to share.

Usually, strawberry flavors don't usually taste like strawberry, you know what I mean? Usually it's too sweet and too artificial - I mean, you all know what I'm talking about when I say grocery store bought strawberry ice cream taste. This strawberry sorbetto was sooooo yummy though! I got to try other flavors and liked them a lot.

Staff was super friendly, and the store is so cute and quaint! When walking out the door, you can write in a suggestion of what flavor to make next. Overall, I was very happy with the place, and I can't wait to visit again when I'm in the area.
author: Tricia N.

description: The gianduja (sp?) chocolate hazelnut is amazing. I love the texture. The staff is so friendly too. The black sesame didn't taste as rich as that from Garden Creamery. I stick to chocolate hazelnut or pistachio from here. Mmm delicious!
author: Alias A.

description: Probably the best gelato in San Francisco. The texture is the closest you'll find to real European gelato and the flavors, while few, span traditional to interesting and rotate regularly.
author: Justin E.

description:
sooo our bad, the hubs and I totally crashed an extra soft opening of friends and family. We live nearby so I saw this place tonight getting remodeled. It was previously a crepe place and before that an ice cream place. I walked by tonight with the pup and saw that it was open so why not. There was no sign for friends and family. We walk in and gelato on the house! They have def remodeled from the previous crepe place - upgrade for sure. Nice ambience. No seating excpt the bench against the windows. The flavors range from gelato to sorbet with 10 flavors tonight. The owners were there and were super nice. 

The hubs tried the dark chocolate which also had hazelnuts. He was impressed.

I got 3 mini scoops of Irish Coffee, Almost Chai, and Mint Chip Stracchio - all great, light and refreshing. 

They officially open Tuesday the 24th. We'll be back for sure
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Absolutely amazing gelato. Only a handful of flavors, but they are all great (and some change with time). Their signature hazelnut and chocolate (Gianduia) was amazing and tasted super hazelnutty! I also had the cookie coconut and the mint chocolate chip stracciatella and they were both great too. The prices weren't too bad at all considering this is fancy and super tasty gelato.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: I dare you to try their gelato and not fall in love. One small scoop will bring you so much joy that it's well worth the calories. It's a pretty small shop with a few flavors, but don't be fooled by the few options- each one is packed with rich goodness that it's hard to pick just one. It's also a really good spot for vegans who have a sweet tooth. They always have at least one vegan option on deck. ;)
author: Melanie N.

description: Great gelato. Chocolate sorbet was the highlight. But also everything else was fantastic. Nice to see compostable spoons but I wish there was more cone sizes. Five stars
author: Itai V.

description: Every time I have Colette's gelato, I am transported to Italy. Their pistachio gelato is among the best I've had. A sweet treat steps away from work makes it even more delicious. A must try if you are in Soma, SF Area.
author: S. Afreen I.

description: The smoothest, softest, tastiest Gelato I've eaten in my entire life.
author: Abid D.

description:
1. Gelato was fantastic. Hazelnut/Chocolate was on point.

2. So much gelato for only $5. Almost three scoops in a waffle cone. Outrageous portion size! 

Definitely coming back. Recommended to all my friends.
author: Charles C.

description:
One of my friend was insisting that I should go to Coleta and try 
The Gelato and finally I did, OMG!, I tried the Gianduia Or easy for me to remember 
CHOCOLATE HAZELNUT. Its just delicious. They have other flavors.
One day I tried the PASSION FRUIT and follow in LOVE again.
The customer service is great. The owners are always around super nice guys. Its a little more expensive but its totally
Worthy. I Happily pay for HIGH QUALITY.
author: Jesus R.

description: The chocolate mousse is divine. It has only cocoa powder sugar and water but tastes nothing like it. Really creamy and awesome. The pineapple icecream is pretty good as well. This is going to be my new go to for icecream.
author: Yash R.

description:
We had Coletta cater our wedding. We worked with Noah to organize all the day-of details and he was really friendly and responsive in answering all our questions. They were also very accommodating and made us feel special. They showed up on time and quickly set up.

Also, the gelato is SUPER GOOD. We got a ton of comments from our guests about how great the gelato tasted.

We'd definitely recommend having them cater your dessert at a wedding (or anything).
author: Nelson M.

description: Really great quality, fresh and delicious gelato. I only had to try two flavors to decide what to get. They were both amazing. They also had gluten and vegan options.  I have no doubt that they are good as well.
author: Michelle G.

description: Was looking for ice cream in SOMA and literally stumbled on this place. Not in a totally bustling location, but it's worth walking down from SF MOMA for it. Great artisan flavors, only like 8, but all are awesome, craftsman flavors. The lavender was a little too floral for me, but I loved the Black Sesame and Nocciola. Very creamy, great flavor. Good stuff!
author: David L.

description: On par with gelato carts in the streets of Italy. Whenever I am in SF I go here. The Uber/Lyft there and back makes it a pricey treat - 100% worth it and will do it again. Every time. The pistachio especially is a must-try. If you've disliked a pistachio ice cream, yogurt, or gelato in the past, it doesn't matter - *this* pistachio gelato is amazing!!
author: Lana Z.

description: I got chocolate hazelnut gelato. It was yummy. The only downside is that there is limited seating. I would have loved to just sit down and enjoyed my Nutella, because that gelato tasted like magical Nutella ice cream.
author: Maggie S.

description: My favorite spot for gelato in the city hands down! The variety of flavors was great and they even have a running board of new flavor suggestions so they're always trying to keep it fresh. There's not a whole of space in the shop itself, but the quality of product more than makes up for it. The texture is perfect and the pistachio is excellent!
author: John P.

description: Great little spot. Good customer service, down fall just a little is that not very many flavors to chose from but whatever we got was delicious.
author: Juana T.

description:
Hands down the best gelato or ice cream in SF, which is saying something given all the amazing options these days. Everything was amazing, but the Gianduia (hazelnut chocolate) is the champion. Every ingredient stands out clearly and is very high quality.

I had better Gelato once at a crazy gelato fanatic place in Rome, but otherwise, this is as good as it gets.

It's just down the street from me, so I've now had the opportunity to go a bunch of times, and they're always very friendly and engaging, even when there's a line. Owners are total fanatics, I've run across them arriving at the shop at 9P on a saturday night, and instead of going home or going out, they're headed upstairs to pasteurize their own milk.

Only criticism is that I wish they stayed open later!
author: Jim R.

description: It's definitely one of the better gelato places in SF, but the flavors are extremely muted. Real gelato places in Italy are able to achieve both flavor and texture, whereas this place only has the texture right with what seems to be the use of a lot of glucose that dilutes the flavor. With so many ice cream options in SF (Garden Creamery, Mr. Mrs. Misc., Bi-Rite, etc), I feel like the only reason for their popularity is the sheer absence of any other dessert places within a one mile radius, as well as their hipster decor.
author: Kazu O.

description: The flavors change regularly and are very rich in flavor.  Noah, one of the owners was very personable, and eager to share his insight into the production of the product.  I look forward to visiting his place once again!
author: Shaun W.

description:
I went here a couple of weeks ago with my friend and I can definitely say that this place is in my top 5 for ice cream places. The workers here are super friendly and help guide you through the UNIQUE variety of flavors if you need help deciding what to get. 
They have some pretty standard flavors like vanilla and pistachio, but they also have a lot of flavors that are unique and have a lot of different ingredients to it that make it refreshing.
If I remember correctly, there's a parking lot right across the street, so parking isn't difficult and it's location is a little out of ways, but definitely not too far from the main streets and not hidden!
author: Andy N.

description: We craved ice cream and I found this place on Yelp. The 5 star rating is well-deserved!  The unassuming small storefront and plain-looking interior of the store don't do justice to the great gelato served here and I know my gelato, having lived in Italy for over 6 months!  This one was exactly like the one I had in Italy.  I had strawberry and pistachio ice cream.  For those who say that pistachio did not taste like pistachio, mind you, this is not the pistachio you get from Carvel or Baskin Robbins!  My only regret is that I went with the piccolo cup!  Should have gotten the grande!
author: Baby S.

description: Our new fav! Delicious and seasonal.  This is real gelato and if you like Italian ice cream you will recognize the quality here.
author: James G.

description: Absolutely a must try in SF -competes and beats the best gelato I have sampled in Rome, Florence, Milan, Sienna, and others.  I love the Gianduia! It's rich, creamy slice of heaven.  The almond and pistachio are high quality gelato.  We catered to two occasions in South Bay and Henri, Antonio and Noah were super generous with their time.  Highly recommend the cool box (2 flavors) that fed over 60 people.
author: Na H.

description: Simply amazing - some of the best gelato I've ever had! We had thin mint (self-explanatory), gianduia (chocolate hazelnut with I think waffle cone pieces in it), salted butter caramel (super buttery), and almond (simple but maybe my favorite one). The location is small so don't bring a big group and expect to sit inside. Our party of two was very comfortable at the counter seating and it was fun to vote for the next round of flavors!
author: Kendall C.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco, flavors change every week.. i had pistachio and salted butter  caramel .. must go in this city!
author: Andrea M.

description: In a tiny  charming corner of SOMA , eight ice creamot flavors and a small coffee machine make the magic . Pistachio, turmeric, black sesame...are simply delicious! Bonus- kind and thoughtful service .
author: Orit E.

description: Cool, unusual flavors! They also have a chalkboard where you can vote on their next weird flavor.
author: Evan Z.

description: Really nice service and the gelato is shockingly delicious. I was really impressed. And I usually only like Bi-Rite and Three Twins ice cream.
author: Erin C.

description:
Best ice cream / gelato / cold treat ever! 

Came here based on the suggestion of my foodie friends and was impressed the flavors were all amazing. I had the large size which lets you get three flavors after I tried three and couldn't decide.... it's that good! The mango was amazing, coffee crunch had an awesome flavor and chunks of bursts, mint was sooooo minty fresh. 

Scared that this place is a block away from me....
author: Alan M.

description:
I only work a few blocks away from here and have heard from my coworkers that this place is amazing. So I finally got the chance to try it today and they were right. Real authentic gelato that is smooth, creamy, and packs an amazing amount of flavor. I had a hard time trying to decided between all the flavors after getting samples as they all tastes like what they should be. I finally settled on a cup of with pistachio and saffron gelato for $5. The pistachio gelato stands out and could totally just ate that by itself. The saffron is subtle and the flavor comes out after a few seconds of it melting in your mouth.

I would definitely come back for authentic gelato, rain or shine.
author: Hong P.

description:
The rain has finally slowed down in SF and the weather is finally getting warmer. That means it's finally gelato season! Actually scratch that, it's always gelato season! There surprisingly aren't many gelato places in the FIDI area, so it was definitely a welcome treat to see Coletta open a few blocks from my place.

The staff was super nice and I was able to be a pig and sample many different flavors before settling on Gianduia (Chocolate Hazelnut) and Pistachio while my GF got the Fier de latte. The Gianduia and Pistachio were super smooth and creamy, but just a bit too rich for my taste. The Fier de latte however had the perfect blend of sweetness to go along with the same smooth, creamy texture. I believe they have different flavors everyday, so I will definitely come back and try other flavors or settle for the Flier de latte.

There is also a board by the door where customers can write down flavors you would like to see in the future. So my GF and I proceeded to went ham and wrote down several flavors. So if you see Durian or Taro in the near future, you can thank us!

#YummyInMyTimmy
author: Tim L.

description: I just happened to turn down Harrison one evening and bumped into this adorable little gelato shop. I was having a rough night, and Coletta Gelato came through with a perfect little cup of comfort in the form of Chocolate Hazelnut gelato. The space is charming, the employee was super-kind and treated me warmly. I think I'll turn down Harrison each time I come back to the city now!
author: Kate L.

description: Rather limited selection, but their service is great and the place isn't too hard to find. Flavors are updated every week and they take suggestions!
author: Fiona P.

description:
Came here after work on Friday. 

Decor was great. Simple and rustic. Jars on the wall contained what appears to be their main ingredients. 

Henri, the guy behind the counter was very friendly and assisted me in my quest to find the perfect flavor to satisfy my ice cream craving. 

Tried almost all the flavors and finally settled on a combo of the giandula, peanut better dark chocolate and strawberry. 

All I can say is that it was heavenly. Adjectives like soft and creamy come to mind.

Flavors were strong yet not overpowering. Sweetness was at the appropriate level and didn't leave a "first ingredient was sugar vibe".

Giandula was great, tasted like the inner of a Ferro Rocher and had some what appeared to be wafer pieces that were a nice textual surprise. 

Peanut Butter and Dark Chocolate tasted like a more complex less sugary Reese's. 

Strawberry tasted fresh and real. It was very crisp. A bit icier since it was a sorbeto. 

All in all, i give this place 5 stars for great friendly service and a delicious product.
author: Clement T.

description: We stopped in as a rain storm took over the streets of SF and boy are we glad we did! The flavors were so yummy that I had to get the double scoop. I couldn't choose! I got the gianduia and cookie coconut... but you really couldn't go wrong. I sampled most of them and didn't feel judged doing it!
author: Lisa H.

description: Delicious ice cream, convenient location. Always a treat. Small selection, but everything they have is tasty.
author: D K.

description:
HELL.YES. Awesome ice cream place, the flavors and texture are to die for. It takes me back to Europe right away. 

Could be on the cheaper end though (I think for the quantity, $4 would be enough).
author: Margaux M.

description: Best gelato favors I've ever had, including gelato in Italy. Pistachio, almond and milk tea are amazing. This place is the perfect balance between authentic gelato and flavor innovation.
author: Lisa H.

description: This is a small gelato shop that serves creamy, velvety gelato right in SF SOMA.  I got a small ($5) Gianduia, which is essentially the gelato form of ferrero rocher.  Soooo goood, the texture and flavor is on point.  They rotate their flavors every week but Gianduia is their most popular one, so I don't think that will be out of the rotation anytime soon.
author: Jessica Z.

description:
Visiting town and was really craving some good gelato. Safe to say, I got some good gelato and for less than I expected! 

The flavors they had were delicious and it free try a sample of which ever one you would like. Price was not even a worry. 

Go get some gelato here folks!
author: Kurtis B.

description:
So delicious!! All the flavors I had were amazing and it seems like they are constantly experimenting with new ones. 

They also have some dairy free options were are hands down delicious. Service is great too :)
author: Naureen H.

description: Simply amazing. The dark chocolate mousse might be the best chocolate ice cream I've ever had! The coconut cookie and almond flavors were delicious, too
author: Ann K.

description: This is the best Gelato in SF and all California! We tried the chocolate hazelnut omg foodporn!!  , we loved mango as well and the pistachio were delicious! The staff was friendly and patient ! Even my 15 month old daughter loved all flavors  definitely will come here again when we visit SF.
author: Erika C.

description: Really good pistachio, choc hazelnut, chai. They only have select flavors on certain days.  The take home prepackaged containers are the best bargain.
author: Delisa R.

description: They make their own base for the gelato (which is something they had to get a permit for). In California you usually have to use a pre-made base (Strauss is usually the brand most San Francisco ice cream places use), which is fine, but most of the time it ends up being too sweet. I had a chance to taste the base they make (fior di latte) and oh my gosh! The texture is just perfect and not too sweet! I would buy a pint of that just by itself! Another quality place in San Francisco - Highly recommend.
author: Alyssa D.

description: This location has been a variety of different businesses but I hope that Coletta makes a go of it because it's really good.  I took my boys here the other day and they loved the gelato they got...and I did too.  There were quite a few people inside too which is always a good sign.  Friendly staff with great treats.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Blake B.

description: Absolutely delicious-amazing fresh flavors! We're from out of town but this will be a favorite spot any time we are  in San Francisco. Pumpkin Chai - heaven!!!
author: Karen G.

description: It's a small spot on Harrison street. The Gianduia is unreal- I highly recommend it. Much different from your everyday gelato experience and a nice getaway from the downtown chaos. Get your friends some gift cards-they won't be upset.
author: Varun D.

description:
I am a super picky food lover. So picky that I didn't even like the Gelatos that I had in Italy. 

But this place, is SUPER good. The quality of the ice cream I had was 5 star+ . Never had anything like that before.
author: Sierra Y.

description:
Incredible delicious gelato. I had the Pistachio and it was orgasmic! Creamy, rich and more pistachio taste than cream taste...
Highly recommend and while not cheap, the pints are reasonable for handmade...
author: Steve S.

description:
Wow. What can I say? 
Amazing gelato. Fresh local ingredients, wonderful service. Great to have this option close to work. Definitely will pick up some pints on my way home. Can't wait for this place to really get going!
author: Parker H.

description: I'm not a huge ice cream person, but this place is simply amazing! Unique flavors, light and so creamy! They also have non dairy options. Must check out.
author: Amy Y.

description: The best ice cream in San Francisco, hands down! Can't beat the fresh flavor and velvety texture. Their flavor options are constantly changing but they always have a few staple favorites. The owners/creators/masterminds went to the Gelato University in Italy and really know their stuff. Their sorbetto options are also vegan friendly!
author: Jacques B.

description: So delicious!!! We walked from union square just to try this place and it was absolutely worth it. I got the pistachio and coffee cardamom. Pistachio is a must if that's your speed. Rum and coconut was also tasty. Highly recommend.
author: Ash G.

description: Delicious and refreshing. Had the grapefruit and CA Almond flavors in a waffle cone. Cute decor. Melts quickly - esp. on a warm day!
author: Sarah T.

description: Finally made it here when San Francisco had record heat (aka had to actually experience real summer weather for two days). The strawberry gelato gave me LIFE. Do wish they had a few more light options, as most of the flavors were super creamy/heavy looking. Looks like they switch out their flavors pretty often though, so looking forward to trying more!!
author: Rachel K.

description: So great! Literally the best and most accurate gelato outside of Italy! Absolutely delicious
author: Nats S.

description: The best gelato in town! I especially love the Nutella flavored one (I'm forgetting the name). Hands down the best. You have to go.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Awesome taste and richness. Tad expensive. But it's all relative :) 

Minus one star for the relatively small portion for the price charged. 

Service was awesome.
author: Sanjay N.

description: Our favorite gelato place in sf!! So many flavors to choose from. Noah (owner) was nice enough to give us a tour of the back and took his time to explain the art of gelato making. My son was fascinated!!
author: Annalisa T.

description: Great gelato, exactly like in Italy. Absolutely authentic. You must take your kids there
author: Luigi P.

description: Friendly service in a cute little store with a few indoor seats and a bench out front. Close enough to Yerba Buena Gardens that you can walk there to enjoy... oh who am I kidding? You'll polish off your gelato way before you get that far! Delicious, inventive flavors and always something new to try.
author: Kenneth S.

description: I grew up in Rome and moved to SF a couple of years ago. One of the things I always missed was a real Gelato. Finally found Coletta, authentic like I used to taste when in Italy. Hope they keep the quality high as they scale up. (The only one close is GROM but it's in Malibù).
author: Sinz O.

description: This actually deserves more than 5 stars- the gelato is sooo good!! I make myself wait & crave it for three days before rewarding myself to go again- it's THAT good!! :)
author: Brittany K.

description: So very delicious and close to my work's office. Reminds me of hot summer days traveling in Italy, eating gelato at least once a day. Bright delicious flavors, creamy textures. All the flavors I've had are great, but pistachio is my number one favorite. I dream of it, oh such sweet dreams!
author: Gabriela C.

description: Seriously good gelato! New flavours every week. $5, $7, $10 portions, cup or (delicious) waffle cone. I tried the Gianduia (choc + hazelnut) and coconut cookie, both were exquisite, especially the hazelnut one. I'm gonna be back here soon!
author: Dejana B.

description: It is hands down the best gelato in the bay area. Flavors change every week and they nail every one!
author: Karishma K.

description: This spot has the most delicious gelato in the area and that's saying a lot. I loved how they change the flavors and give you variety. The staff is also super welcoming and friendly. Don't miss this place! Because who else has 5 stars from ABSOLUTELY EVERYONE who comes?
author: Camille B.

description: Definitely one of the best gelato/ice cream in SF. I love the unique flavors and each flavor packs a punch. The weekly changing flavors helps keep things fresh.
author: T M.

description: I want to move to SF just for this gelato!!! I had the pistachio and horchata...YUM!!!
author: Kate S.

description: Really good gelato, kind of in the middle of nowhere, and a little pricey, but worth a try.
author: Wendy M.

description: Came here on national ice cream day in Summer 2017 - the weather was awesomely sunny today  Had Pistachio and CA Almond in a cone. Gelato tasted as fabulously delicious as the ones I had in Italy! To celebrate this food holiday on the 3rd Sunday in July, a mystery ice cream was given to the customers for a free scoop of ice cream if guessing the flavor right. All in all, very nice experience although I didn't guess it right!
author: Jessica H.

description: excellent gelato/sorbet in both intense flavor and creamy texture. gianduja without the j is a perfect chocolate hazelnut airy smooth flavor popping treat. so is fresa with excellent fruity sorbetto like you'd have in italy.
author: Rob C.

description: Real honest to god Italian gelato like you can't find anywhere else in the area. Lovely staff. I haven't been disappointed by a flavor yet, but the seasonal sorbettos are particularly good.
author: saru k.

description: Stopped here after a giants game. Amazing ice cream, get the almond! so good!
author: Emery G.

description: Fantastic! My boyfriend and I have huge sweet tooths and are always on the hunt for fantastic desserts. This is a new gelato spot in the SOMA, relatively available parking around the building. They have flavors of the day that usually rotate. I HIGHLY recommend the chocolate with hazelnut gelato, they never rotate that flavor because it sells out every time! I love the vibe of this place, the fact that they make all the gelato in house and there are no preservatives is a plus!
author: Laura K.

description: Best Gelato in SF. Holy moly might as well be in Italy. Love it. Yum yum yum the hazelnut is DANKKKK
author: Steph W.

description:
Great place we visited last Sunday 
Really nice lady behind the counter 
Going back today
author: Eldert W.

description: Best ice scream in San Francisco! Traditional Italian style. Pistaccio just killed me :) amazing!
author: Alex B.

description: I work a block away and this is my new go to place for ice cream/gelato/sorbetto.  It is absolutely delicious.  What really sets this place apart is even though they only serve eight flavors a day and a week (they said they rotate flavors every week), they offer a variety of different flavors from the traditional nocciola, pistachio, chocolate.  I've had banana rum raisin, nougat, milk tea, irish coffee, meyer lemon sorbetto, these are all so delicious.  I will be honest, it's definitely on the pricier side but what in SF isn't with the rent being so high.  It's definitely worth the price.  I keep getting the small but I think I'm going to start getting the large since it's only a $2 difference.  Even though our office is awesome, this place makes every week so much better!
author: Pierre L.

description: Awesome.  Small batch, great flavors.  Super close to me, I'll definitely be back.
author: Dan K.

description: This place is absolutely divine. It is worth visiting even on a cold and dreary day. The pistachio flavor is smooth, creamy, and packed full of flavors. I can't wait for my next visit.
author: Taylor G.

description: This place doesn't need another 5 star review, but it is seriously the best gelato ever. Closest I've ever tasted to the gelato you get in Italy. I'm so happy this is in SF
author: Priscilla T.

description: SOOOO FREAKIN GOOOOD!!! The texture of the gelato is everything!! Not to mention the ever-changing fresh/yummy flavors, generous portions, and friendly staff. Closest thing I've had in the Bay Area to the gelato in Italy. What more can I say? 5 stars for sure.
author: Heather Q.

description: Best gelato I've ever had! Their gelato and sorbet is super fresh and smooth. I got the Strawberry sorbet and Stracciatella (Italian chocolate). Their milk tea gelato is amazing as well!! Highly recommend
author: Aishani B.

description: The best Gelato I have ever had.. I am a big chocolate fan. Gianduia Flavor is the best. There is no better place to get Gelato than this. I am surely going back
author: Pradhyumna K.

description: Rotating flavors suggested by customers. I just had Coconut cookie and it tasted like a Samoa girl scout cookie :) Coletta never disappoints!
author: Rosie O.

description: I love love love Coletta Gelato. There's simply no gelato like this in the city. It's easily the most authentic. The owners are really warm people who are incredibly passionate about their craft. Their flavors are wonderful with Irish Coffee and Pistachio being my favorites. They rotate the menu every day as they make new gelato literally every day. My love affair with Coletta Gelato has only just begun!
author: Nikunj K.

description: Amazing ice cream, reminds me of Smitten, and better! I had hazelnut chocolate. It was the best I have ever tried. Rich, but not overly sweet. Service was wonderful too. Very nice guys :)
author: Anonymous L.

description: Great gelato and excellent service! At first I thought it was quite expensive but they give VERY generous serving and the taste just makes every penny worth it. Would definitely come back.
author: Katrina Y.

description: This place is incredible. Best gelato I've had since Italy. I highly recommend trying this place! It is well worth it
author: Jessica M.

description: The almond gelato was surprisingly good. The chocolate and peanut butter also went above and beyond their ice cream counterparts.  Would definitely come back for more.
author: Matt H.

description: My husband and I stopped by tonight on opening day after reading an article about this new gelato shop in the neighborhood in EaterSF. Being huge gelato lovers, we couldn't wait to try out this place! Even though it was 15 minutes before closing, the owners were still cranking out fresh gelato. We shared a large with three flavors, their chocolate hazelnut (fresh batch!), amaretto and pistachio. All were delicious! This is easily the best gelato in the bay area and is up there with the best in Italy. Although its a little pricey, you definitely get what you pay for in quality. We are so pumped to finally have great gelato/ice cream in the neighborhood! We will be back!
author: Amy S.

description: The most authentic gelato outside of Italy! You will think you're in Roma if the Italian owner serves you with his charming smile.
author: Kelley L.

description: Coletta has spoiled me for any other ice cream forever. The chocolate hazelnut ( guanduja) is as good, if not better than, great sex. Totally adorable setting, colors, name,  EVERYTHING!
author: Joan P.

description: We stopped in on our way home for the first time after noticing the new store front off forth st.  Walking in it's a cute little gelato place that is a great pit stop after a long day. There was multiple choices of flavors that they let you try. The gelato was so smooth and creamy and was delicious! As well they had three guys working whom all three were very vibrant and great customer service! A new neighborhood spot in soma that we will for sure be back for.
author: Kristen P.

description:
Love love loved it! This is my new favorite gelato place in the bay area. I wish the shop were a bit bigger though as it tends to get crowded. They had beautiful flavours though I found myself missing a deep intense chocolate and a clean and simple vanilla bean flavor on their menu. The mango one was simply superb.

The strawberry, pistachio, and fiora de latte were delicious but a bit TOO SWEET. 

Can't wait to come back and try some more flavors!
author: Yelper 2.

description: What a treat! I cannot tell you how DELICIOUS this gelato was! I have been in Italy, I'm married to a born and raised Italian man, and I am here to tell you how GOOD and AUTHENTIC this gelato is. I don't know if any other place in the SF Bay Area with gelato this good. Give it a try, I find it hard to believe you'll be disappointed.
