I met one of the owners briefly and he mentioned how they trained in Italy (Bologna) how to learn how make authentic gelato. Go try it!! Amazingly good:) and small shop local guys.
author: Maria B.

description: Without a doubt the best gelato in San Francisco and perhaps the entire Bay Area all of California the entire United States and western hemisphere.  Spare your self the time and expense of a trip to Rome and enjoy delicious authentic Italian gelato at the corner of 3rd and Harrison in San Francisco.  Every flavor I tasted was spectacular, especially the grapefruit and melon. I will be coming back here as often as possible. My ice cream addiction is now full-blown.
author: David T.

description: This is the greatest gelato I've ever had, and I would consider myself a highly experienced ice cream and gelato eater
author: Eric H.

description: Really strong flavors and super creamy. So exited to have a new gelato place in the city!
author: Beck P.

description: Peanut butter and dark chocolate to die for... Perfect afternoon pick me up in the middle of the workday. I will definitely be coming back again and again..
author: Jasmine G.

description: Best gelato I've ever tasted! Matched with friendly service and a very cool layout - definitely recommend this spot!
author: Cheyenne W.

description: Love it!!!!! I got a small and it came w/ 2 scoops! Flavor was amazing. You can tell they make everything in house.
author: Austin M.

description: Simple little shop with absolutely amazing ice cream and gelato.  Good selection, and flavors change regularly, so definitely come back often.  Very lucky to have this place in the neighborhood, a favorite of ours.
author: Matt S.

description: Outstanding gelato and a wonderful staff! If you are on your way to a Giants game or just in the soma area, check it out!
author: Jennicer T.

description:
Real Artisan Italian ice cream!
Words are not enough to describe the absolute perfect quality of those ice creams, made by people who went to study in Italy to learn to make REAL ice cream, and everyone knows that Italians make the best ice creams!
I urge everyone to check it out and see for yourself! 
I am not going to buy ice cream from anyone else in San Francisco, nobody can do as good a job and I've tried everything else believe me ;-)
author: Lucien W.

description: These guys are craftsmen.  The best gelato in SF hands down. The texture is reminiscent of gelato I remember in Rome.
author: Paul C.

description:
It's rad. I think it's the best local Gelato place I've been to in the Bay Area. 

The owners are incredibly nice, and always excited to provide great recommendations.

My personal favourite flavours are the Chocolate Sorbet, because there's nothing like it, and the Pistachio, because it pairs so well.
author: Sargun D.

description: Omg omg omg. Just came back from Europe and this gelato is just as good if not better than any i had. The vegan flavors are EXCEPTIONAL and taste creamy and rich. I work close by, so this is going to be a very delicious habit. I hope they can work on a xylitol sweetened one (had a dark chocolate vegan one in Berlin that was amazing) so I can feel less guilty eating these. SO GOOD.
author: Margot G.

description: Delicious, not too sweet, real flavorful. The pistachio tasted of nuts and was smooth and delicious. The chocolate hazelnut was to die for. Service personnel were extremely friendly, informative and patient. A great value for the waistline, tastebuds and pocketbook!
author: Janet K.

description:
A hidden gem where I can treat myself to the best gelato in town. 

They are always open to taking suggestion and trying out new flavors. I love their strawberry and pear flavors because I can actually taste freshness from the fruits they use.
author: kevin l.

description: Nice to find this place after spending several weeks in Italy on an un-official gelato tour.  This place ranks up there with the best I had in Italy - very creamy with great flavor.  Only wished they carried more flavors.  I got used to 1/2 dark chocolate and 1/2 stracciatella every day :-)  Staff is very patient and pleasant as well.
author: Scott R.

description: Stumbled upon their gelato stand in a furniture store in Valencia.  My family and I loved it!  Mango was on point! Chocolate hazelnut was heavenly!  Deliciously creamy! Definitely on my top 3 choices for gelato/ice cream!
author: R S.

description: The most perfectly authentic Italian gelato in the Bay Area. Absolutely heavenly.
author: katie k.

description: Fabulous! Went here with  the family last night and loved the gianduia, peanut chocolate, pistachio, and matcha gelatos- they were creamy with intense flavors just like what we had in Italy. The guava and white peach sorbets also intense, smooth amd wonderful. Go here and you won't be sorry.
author: Stacy S.

description: After developing taste and some expertise all over the world for gelato: this is certainly among the very best. High quality , tastiness, pleasant service,  and cleanliness are the tops. Especially liked rosemary flavor in nice cone.
author: Ed P.

description: Most delicious strawberry gelato I've ever tasted (hard to imagine better).
author: Paul D.

description: This was fantastic gelato. Never written a review before but the service was so good I felt compelled to. The employee who prepared our gelato was very charismatic from the beginning, humorous, and made the experience very worth while. Very pleased with this place.
author: Emmett G.

description: Coletta is the best! The owners are passionate about their gelato and it really comes through in how they explain the flavors. You can tell they are really proud of it. And they should be! It's the creamiest gelato I've had. We are very excited to have a new hit place in Soma and no longer need to go to Birite/Humphrey etc....my hubby is more of an ice cream fan for the creaminess and I am more of a gelato fan for the lighter texture...but this satisfied both of us and the flavors were over the top. The Giaduia is extra special with a little hint of crispiness blended with the creaminess. All of the flavors we tried were amazing and I only regret that we can't go everyday because we need our pants to fit! I also love the freshness, they only have about 8 flavors. I like this much better than typical gelato where they have dozens of flavors and it is overwhelming. They focus on a few things and doing them very well. Looking forward to going back next weekend!
author: Katelyn W.

description: This is the best gelato I have ever had and exactly what this neighborhood needed! My wife and I traveled to Italy for 3 weeks last summer, had gelato no less than a dozen times and this is perfection. Well done!
author: David H.

description: Fantastic gelato. The owners are super friendly and the quality cannot be beat. Very clean, very tasty
author: Steve J.

description: Passed by this place on my way to the giants game and decided to try it out. The staff was super friendly, and the gelato was delicious. Definitely recommend anyone visiting the city.
author: Laura P.

description: Possibly the best gelato we've eaten. The flavors are zesty, and the gelato is smooth. One of the best features is that it is not heavy. We'll be back for more.
author: V-H D.

description: Simply the best gelato I have ever had. The chocolate hazelnut one is something to die for: Heavenly texture and flavor, not too sweet. The service is wonderful too!
author: Dan X.

description: This place is a gem!! Phenomenal gelato and the owners couldn't be nicer and more enthusiastic. I highly recommend the chai flavor.
author: Amy S.

description: The gelato here is amazing and the owner is very friendly. I had the pineapple sorbet and it was the smoothest sorbet I have ever had. And it tasted delicious. My girlfriend got the Nutella gelato and again, it was delicious. I'll absolutely be going here again.
author: Adam B.

description: The gelato in Coletta reminds me of that in Italy. Great flavor but not heavy. I am not an ice-cream person but I stop here twice for a scope of Gelato this week already. (even on a cold day) I have the strawberry and guava today and like both of them. They made their ice-cream in-house. Welcome another small business to the neighborhood.  There is not a lot of foot traffic in that part of the Harrison so most of their business is really from word of mouth.  For what I see so far, they have a very good start.
author: Jonathan H.

description: came here last week with my daughter maia for some quality girls' time and +gelatooooo+. maia was apparently the first kid customer there since their recent opening and she was very flattered : ) more importantly, she loved the ice cream (melon!) and so did i (coco-hazelnut)! it was a tad bit too sweet for me but certainly not for maia. the portions were generous, the consistency absolutely perfect, the flavor choices very creative. the little store is cute and probably way too crowded soon. good luck, coletta gelato! looking forward to seeing (and tasting) lots of you this summer!
author: Antonia B.

description: This is seriously the best thing I have ever put in my mouth. The gelato is incredible. It has a good homey vibe and the owners are incredibly nice. They spent time to tell me how it was made and just greater customer service overall.  Welcome to the neighborhood.
author: Seth F.

description: Fantastic!! Best gelato ousted of Italy, hsnds-down! Forget the other "gelato" places which are poor substitutes.
author: Deanne D.

description: Came by for the soft-opening last night and all I can say is DELICIOUS!!! I'm not a big fan of dessert, and really not a big fan of ice cream, but the flavors Colette Gelato offers are unique, flavorful, and refreshing. My favorites were Mango Sorbet, Mint Chip Stracciatella, and Gianduia (tasted like Nutella!!!). The owners were incredibly friendly and the ambiance of the place is great. I'll definitely be coming back when they officially open on the 24th.
author: Nadi C.

description: i dont really eat ice cream but i tried this gelato place on the way back from getting a burrito. i had the pistachio with another flavor. its five bucks for a small cup but they do put a heaping in there- not like super huge- but for us just over 30 crowd thats enough sugar. i count my grams of sugar- so they dont really make an y sugar sub gelato -- but its pretty good for gelato. you can never tell sugar by the taste as it can be melt down and so can butter but theirs taste like they know something of what they are doing. if i get a craving ill walk down here again! defintely worth it ! its on a non descript corner with minimal decor inside.
author: A N.

description: got the hazelnut.. it tastes like Italy
author: Henry H.
